Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: perfectdaygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights. Our room was clean, overlooking the street, bathroom was spacious, free wifi in the room a real plus. The bed was fabulous. Staff were English speaking and helpful. They offer breakfast for 12 euro (we never tried it). They also have a laundromat a couple of doors down which was really handy. The hotel is close to La Rambla if you want to be right in the action. Really the only downside was the price, we paid approx 840 euro for the five nights. Others we met seemed to think this was pricey. Hard to tell, we have had far better prices in the rest of Spain (including Madrid) so not sure if this is just a Barcelona issue in that prices here are higher. We did have a hell of a time trying to book accommodation in Barcelona, we took this hotel after being told by about 7 others that they were full. Would advise to shop around if you can. However, if you do decide on Hotel Principal, I dont think you would have any complaints, its not stunningly attractive or anything, just a good generic hotel that offers most of what you need and is well run.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: akane122281
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Principal while he was at a conference. It's a charming boutique and from what his coworkers said and my own experience the rooms seem to be a hit or miss. We requested a room on the top floor and were totally impressed but couldn't get the wifi to work no matter how many requests we made to the front desk. Our room was definitely roomy with a great balcony and more space then I've seen in many European hotels. However, I believe not all the rooms are modern and may need some remodeling. I think that this is a great hotel to stay at if you're looking to be near La Rambla and the fun tourist attractions and they would could get a better rating if the rooms were all a bit nicer like ours and that the front desk was more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: alarose
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located one minute walk from La Ramblas street. It's so close I was amazed. The hotel is very clean and the room is spacious with a nice bathroom. Free wifi is awesome. I would recommend this to anyone coming to Barcelona because you want to be close to La Ramblas. I read other comments about sketchy people outside the hotel however I saw sketchy people everywhere but the street was always buzy and no one was by our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent set up but bad impression from the service”
Reviews.Author: EmSea82
Reviews.Content: The hotel set up is very simple, clean and very basic. It comes with the basic travel necessities provided (such as free wifi, paid computer access with printer). The pros: - central location. Just off La Rambla and is about 5 minutes walk to the Liceau metro. Great access to some really nice cafe and bakeries. And La Rambla seemed central to lots of tourist spots and great eat outs. - free wifi - definitely a great plus. Also the paid pc plus printer means we could check in to our flight ahead of time. What made the experience not so pleasant: - the receptionist was rather rude and did not attend to request to fix the fused power socket. I had to call back half hour later to follow up, only to learnt that he had not done anything and responded reluctantly saying that he was busy (at 1230am). It was my first day at the hotel after spending a full day flying, so didn't give me a favorable impression - solid hard bed and made worst with bad pillow. Had to endure back pain throughout my one week stay here - centrally controlled air temperature and the air conditining made some really annoying noise.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Las Ramblas, inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: Steve M
Reviews.Content: Good position, walking distance to city sights and public transport close at hand. parts of the hotel are very old and interesting architecturally, but the room that we had was modern and basic, with good shower facility (no bath). The room was generally quiet, but sound did carry along the hallways, I get the feeling that if it was a busy time then it could be noisy. The area is a little rough at night if you turn the wrong way out of the hotel. Beds were incredibly hard, i like a firm bed, but this was like sleeping on the floor! Service was good when needed, if a little aloof, English spoken by all at front desk. Good value for money for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well.....”
Reviews.Author: Ivy X
Reviews.Content: ....where to start!? The breakfast could be more comprehensive. We had three mornings there and eat more or less the same, if you stay there longer it could be tiring. coffee and tea (three varieties) scrambled eggs, fried bacon, baked beans (if you're British then "yeah!!") croissants (with a sugar icing), milk rolls three varieties of jam (strawberry, peach and apple/plum, unfortunately not that good) wholemeal toast (not toasted), ciabatta (that was toasted), toasted milk rolls and tiny rolls (which them you can injure people) sliced cheese, salami, boiled ham (just one sort of each) two sorts of cornflakes and milk or yoghurt for it The rooms were to the courtyard with neighbors across that started to play traditional music at 1 p.m. The double bed was to small for two people, the bedding were two sheets with a woollen blanket in between all lose and the woollen blanket was full of all kinds of hair, and I mean all kinds! (if you know what I mean) For the first two days we didn't had a toilet brush! And we got one after we asked for it two times! The worst were the very the thin walls, you can hear your neighbor breath! The personnel was average friendly! The location is fantastic, near La Rambla and metro station Liceu on the green line 3. Diagonally opposite is a very well equipped supermarket (Condis) So if you spend all day somewhere in the city and and not setting value on recreative sleep than it's a good choice, but don't forget not to book breakfast ;-) There are several options to eat breakfast somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the right traveller.”
Reviews.Author: Bogotarocks
Reviews.Content: Whenever you review a hotel you have to review it for what it is and for the situation you used it for. This is only a 2 star hotel and I used it for a stag with 26 guys. The fact it takes a stag of 26 of us tells you that it's probably not somewhere you want to go to celebrate your 20 year wedding anniversary. The location is great (for a stag party), it was cheap, the rooms were clean, it's basically in Ramblas, free WI FI, and the staff were pleasant enough. On the flip side it is basic, it is in a seedy area, and there are working girls and thieves out at night. I don't know what some people want from a 2star hotel in one of Europe's most prominent cities. Read one guy on here who said he had a sub par honeymoon, well how about not taking your wife to a 2star hotel on your honeymoon? I am sorry you don't go to 2star hotels for a hotel experience, you go there for somewhere to hang your clothes and for a bed. It's not for special occasions, it's not for couples, and it's not for a relaxing break or hotel experience. For budget travelers, groups of young people, and stag/hen parties it does what it does very well. For the people moaning you pay for what you get in life, I suggest you book the four seasons next time.

Reviews.Title: “What a great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: martitalugo
Reviews.Content: I arrived earlier than the room was ready. They offer to place my luggage in a safe place while I sight see for awhile. Any question I have the answer promptly and/or help me with. Clean rooms, VERY friendly personnel. FREE WIFI-very good connection! Close to Ramblas. Will be back definitively.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kapuchok
Reviews.Content: Good: + Great location. + Rooms clean and basic. + Free WIFI Not so Good: - Early check-in. - Central air. - We have some problems with the bathroom shower! - Noisy floors .

Reviews.Title: “great location of las ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Nehmaiz
Reviews.Content: a little bit hard to find at first, but once you locate it you'll see how close it is to las ramblas. was asked to pay whole amount up front, a bit unusual but that's their policy. wifi was a bit inconsistant. other wise the room was very clean, tidy and compfy. will definitely book it again when in barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful close to las ramblas”
Reviews.Author: rodgtraveller
Reviews.Content: Great, modern hotel located in funky area right next to the Las Ramblas road. Highly recommended and no negatives at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very Surprising”
Reviews.Author: italy_loverUk
Reviews.Content: We arrived early (10.30 am) expecting them to say our ready wasn't ready until 1pm (the official check in time) but the room was ready! I have to say it was very nice, spacious, wonderful powerful shower and all you can ask for really. The only fault was that they provide a kettle with tea bags, and sugar but no coffee or milk (apparently you had to pay extra for those?!) anyway that's a small gripe really. The staff were friendly in the main and for the price you pay it really was a bargin. The location is amazing, just a few blocks from Las Ramblas we heard next to nothing, 5 min stroll to th nearest Metro stop (Liceu) and not really in the dodgy bit of the Ravel which we were concerned about. i would recommend this without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: devansh68
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th time at Hotel Principal. Excellent location just a few minutes walk from Las Ramblas. The family room was huge. Neat & clean hotel with excellent staff and a decent breakfast. Access to the hotel at night may be a little shady but quite safe. Within close proximity to the underground and also several bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “i liked it”
Reviews.Author: timo59
Reviews.Content: I arrived late at night, I just knew that I wanted somwhere in Rambla, it was raining cats and dogs and I didn't have any reservation...I asked some hotels, or they were full or the prices were so high,suddenly I saw this hotel , I asked the price for a single-bed room , it was 60 euro, for me it was ok, but before giving the passport i wanted to see my room, I really liked it , everything was good and I couldn't find anything wrong ...I was just arrived from Italy , and i continued in talking in italian and not english and the most beautiful part was that there was a guy expert in italian so i didn't have even to think in english in that miserable situation in which i was...hey..the breakfast is Buffet, but real Buffet, it has everything, i usually ate a lot late in the morning as a brunch! :) I stayed there four nights and i will be back to this hotel if i go back to Barcellona some day which i don't think i will do..generally speaking Barcelona doesn't give me a spanish feeling...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaat88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a few days during our citytrip in Barca. We basicly only slept there and had breakfast. It is a nice, clean hotel. Some staffmembers are friendlier than others. Breakfast is good, different things you can eat. I believe it is not included though. I had a two-person room with my boyfriend. The bed was small. My parents had a bed that consists out of two small 2-person beds (the kind we had). That was kind of weird.. The hotel lies central in barcalona, but not on a busy street. Most of the attractions we visited on foot. Some with the metro, which you can take on La Rambla. Only a few minutes walk. I really recommend this hotel while you are staying in Barca for a few days and don't spend lots of time in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: pam j
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights prior to our cruise. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I had contacted the hotel by email earlier in the year to ensure they had disabled facilities and our accommodation was excellent. Our bed was very comfortable and our room and the hotel were very clean. The breakfasts were very good with a wide choice of food. Location brilliant, only 5 minutes walk from Las Rambles and the Metro. Found it good value for money and would certainly recommend it and stay there again if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Tabitha77
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here, skip there breakfast as you are so close to the open market with all the yummy food. Very clean, good value too.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for the cost conscience travel”
Reviews.Author: swdweeb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Principal twice within two weeks, at the beginning and end of a cruise. My wife and I were looking for a hotel close to Las Ramblas without breaking the bank. This hotel is a good fit. The hotel is located a short walk from the Las Ramblas, 3-5 minutes at most. In the daytime and early evening this isn't a problem. However I never felt comfortable walking to the hotel later at night (after 9:00-10:00PM) and always took a taxi back. That said, the hotel was clean, quiet, well maintained and fully functional. The hotel has wifi but only in the lobby. Even there, it was pretty hit or miss. The signal fluctuated constantly. If you need to check email from home, its fine, if you need to work, forget about it. If you're looking for a place to stay while you visit the city, this is a good place. If you're looking to impress, you'll need to look elsewhere. I'd stay here again if I needed to.

Reviews.Title: “Overprice and Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: Fiona D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located - faultless for its access to La Rambla, the Gothic quarter and the seafront. It seems to be very clean and not unattractive but has no memorable features -except the art which is very interesting. The hotel is sitatuated in El Rival which seems to be a mix or students and immigrants; an interesting lively area, and a good contrast to the glossy streets off La Rambla and areas east of Placa de Catalunya. In the eight years I've been travelling to Barcelona, city centre hotels have become v expensive .... but in this instance I sensed a certain 'mean spirited' quality throughout the establishment. No brochures or information about the hotel are provided in the room or offered at reception - so one has to ask/explore to find out for oneself. There's a very pleasant roof terrace we discovered on the last morning. There's a small bar too but not visible to guests. A drink on the roof terrace would have been a lovely way to end an evening - but we knew nothing of these facilities until the morning of our departure Our ensuite room (£90 pppn - £180 for the room) was clean and adequate but spartan and cell like: no easy chair; French windows - but no view with alaramingly minimal natural light. The tea/coffee making facilities we're again 'mean': one tea bag and one sugar per person per night. No coffee and no milk. I believe these were available 'on request' but at £180 per night (excluding breakfast) we feel the hotel could have provided something more. Breakfast at €10 per person was quite good quality and value (a wide choice of foods, well prepared, catering to all tastes) but the dining room has the feel of a hostel - ie grab a trayful of food and cutlery and sit at any table. Although the staff were helpful when asked a question, we felt that they were neither truly congnisant of our presence - minimally communicative/interested - and probably wouldn't have noticed if we disappeared and never returned.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: rosaCork
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice once in nov2008 with party of six girls once in2009 with partner .Really enjoyed stay each time, large bright clean rooms. Great choice of food at breakfast. Hotel situated few mins from main strip La Rambla and ten mins from Airport bus. Would hope to return there and would recomend this hotel to other travellers

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel behind the La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: mundanemuser
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona for 3 nights and this was the perfect hotel to stay around the most happening area of Barcelona. Most of the good hotels around the La Rambla were exorbitantly priced but we got a very good deal on this one. Situated on a quiet street inside the La Rambla, Hotel Principal has big and spacious rooms with attractive little balconies. The beds were very comfy to sleep in and the bathroom was pretty huge as well. Although the breakfast isn't that great (you can rather grab a bite on the La Rambla), overall the hotel is definitely good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet spot a few blocks off the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: travelgalTacoma
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, pre and post-cruise. It's just a couple of blocks off the mid-point of the Ramblas, easy walking distance to the Airport Bus on Placa Catalunya and a short cab ride to the cruise ship port. We found the hotel clean and quiet, and they have a luggage room (with rest rooms) they are generous with. Both rooms we got were quiet at night, there is free wifi throughout the hotel, even on the lovely rooftop patio. The beds were very firm, which i gather is usual in Europe. Of note: one night i booked by Hotels.com, the other directly on the hotel's website. The Hotels.com booking gave us an upgrade to a nicer room for the same price while the hotel website added a small extra charge for ?something.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Perfect for young family”
Reviews.Author: bc4774
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with our 4 year old at the back of the hotel so the room was nice and quiet. The airconditioning was a blessing, as was the little terrace area outside our room. It's about a 5-10 minute walk from Metro Liceu (to get there from the airport, get the Aerobus which stops at Placa Catalunya and it's a 10 minute walk down to hotel). Close to the Barri Gotic, bars, shopping, Metro and bus lines and the fantastic Boqueria Mercat where you'll get to buy the freshest and best produce. Don't let the reputation of Las Ramblas scare you off - just be aware and you'll be fine. There was breakfast on offer but we didn't eat it and had a breakfast each day at a local cafe. Would have liked to have a mini bar in the room to keep some beers on hand. There is a a very hip casual little streetside bar at the end of the road that the hotel is on that makes excellent (and cheap) caprioskas and mojitos - a great way to cap off the night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and silent nights”
Reviews.Author: Villasukka
Reviews.Content: Principal was just few minutes from Ramblas and Liceu underground. The interesting areas (Barri Gotic, Raval, Born) on the other side of Rambla were easy to reach as well. We walked easily everywhere (seaside, Placa Catalunya) and there were nice cafeterias around hotel as well as supermarkets for snacks, water etc. Our room was on 3rd floor, facing the street but it was very quiet and we got good night sleep. It was very clean and air-condition was almost too effective, only thing we missed was a bit softer bed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: sunshinesnow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Principal for 5 nights at the beginning of August. It had been recommended to me by my mum, who had previously stayed there. The best thing about the hotel was definately the location, it couldn't have been better. It is located less than a two minute walk from Las Ramblas (the centre of the city) and the metro stops, making it easy to get around the city. The hotel is, however, far enough away from Las Ramblas that it does not suffer form noise pollution. We were so close to our hotel from everything, that we usually came back to the hotel for a siesta to escape the hot midday sun. The hotel staff were efficient and friendly. The room was perfect (we stayed in a romantic double room 329). It was spacious with a large en suite, two small balconies, air conditioning and a HUGE comfy bed. The breakfast was excellent, with a large selection of food on offer, from fresh fruit and cereal to scrambled eggs and bacon. Its definately worth including the breakfast when booking the room. I can't reccommend this hotel enough. I would advise everyone to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel, close to the Ramblas - impressed”
Reviews.Author: BrightShinyThings
Reviews.Content: Stayed earlier in 2011 and enjoyed it. Contrary to some other reviews, the Hotel was not particularly noisy that we noticed - it is a city centre - and we didn't feel it was in a particularly unsafe area for Barcelona. Any further into the Raval I wouldn't have been comfortable with but this was fine. Do your research before you go on the area & you'll know what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised on location and, being two lone females, we didn't feel worried & would return to this Hotel. This was a concern before we arrived but we had no cause for concern. Barcelona is a wonderful city but it's just a fact that you have to be careful - more so in Barcelona than some other European cities, so as a rule we kept our wits about us and were fine. The room was very clean, reasonably big beds, TV, radio, very smartly laid out with exposed brick walls which seem to be all the rage in Barca; halfway between the style of a business hotel and a boutique hotel. The breakfasts were really very good, with contintental style available, cereals, pastries, cured meats, toast, fruit, bacon, sausage, eggs etc. The only thing I would've liked would've been a mini bar in the room or better, a Hotel bar, although there's a decent cocktail bar on the corner (opposite the Hotel and a couple of streets closer to the Ramblas), and a decent bar called Rita Blue on the same Placa. Overall; would definitely stay here again, and will definitely be back to Barca.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: miguel_9
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading nice reviews on tripadvisor and i have to say that they were right. Stayed just for one night this july and had a very good experience. Great location, very close to the center of the Ramblas, with large rooms, large lcd tv, great bathroom and good beds.The all hotel is very clean and looks new. Overall this hotel is great value for money. I recommend it to everyone going to barcelona and want to stay close to the ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: JennyKiz
Reviews.Content: Great location - the hotel was close to the La Ramblas and within a short walk to the metro. Contrary to the other reviews, I didn't find the area unsafe even at night. The furniture was simple and adequate. They charged us some 3 Euros for the use of the in-room safe, which I thought was odd.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Great shower and great air conditioning!”
Reviews.Author: jewele3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled through Spain for a week ending our trip in Barcelona. I booked this hotel because it was highly rated and one of the least expensive. My husband was concerned because the price was so low but I booked it anyway. He was sooooooooo happy and pleased when we walked in to the hotel lobby and into our room. It was huge! Two double/queen beds and a pull out futon, central air, flat screen tv, and two balconies! The bathroom was also huge and included a walk-in shower with two shower heads (regular and rain shower). Location was fantastic too. It was close to everything and quiet which is a hard combo to find! I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would definitely stay here again. OH! And the water machine in the lobby had beer in it! Score! $1.50 Euro

Reviews.Title: “we won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: janice4327
Reviews.Content: We won't be back to Barcelona. This hotel is fine if you are going on a cruise the next day. But if you go out to the las rambles to sight see or just have a meal, BEWARE, there are thugs on every corner after dark, We know because we were victims. The police will not come to even take a report, perhaps this allows them to say barcelona is safe, just take precautions,HOW many precautions can you take...I hope carnival and other cruise lines will make this a stopping place rather than a starting place.

Reviews.Title: “Very good position and location”
Reviews.Author: PaoloComo83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Hotel Principal for 2 nights on a weekend, we were in Barcelona for a bachelor's party. The rooms are very nice and confortable and hotel offers free wifi internet on all the floors. The position is near Liceu, La Rambla and la Boqueria and from here you can easily get to the metro station, Catalunya square and other different districts. We had also the breakfast pack included but honestly we've never used it!

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Tess009
Reviews.Content: Hotel very central, 5 minutes walk to La Rambla. Lots of restaurants and bars nearby. Rooms clean and basic. Difficult to get a good night's sleep as corridor is very noisey.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice rooms, no wifi”
Reviews.Author: shiranaway
Reviews.Content: the hotel's loacation is excellent! just 5 minutes from the middle of the Rambla and a metro station. the rooms are nice but not more than that. the room and the shower are amall ans not so convinient. as for the wifi - according to the hotel's official website there is a special area in which there is free wifi but none of the guests succeeded in connecing to it :(

Reviews.Title: “Glad I picked this one”
Reviews.Author: BarefootWalk
Reviews.Content: My sister & I stayed in Barcelona for 2 days following a cruise, & I got the task of picking a hotel. The Principal was just what we wanted: friendly & helpful (& English-speaking!) staff, clean room, updated bath, in a great location. I will definitely recommend it to friends, & will stay here again if I'm ever luck enough to return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Its a nice spacious hotel , 3 mins walking from La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: vanidaya
Reviews.Content: Great hotel , its located just off the La Rambla street, approx 3 - 5 mins walking distance. The rooms are quite spacious and comfortable. One should not opt for the breakfast here instead should go out to the La Rambla for it. Breakfast served is quite substandard and not much variety either. Otherwise its a nice accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, service ruined the whole stay”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTheWorld20
Reviews.Content: We arrived with 4 travelers after we requested three beds. We did not realize this would be an issue, so when we got to the front desk the receptionist simply told us we would have to pay extra. So we agreed to do this. The receptionist said he would comp us breakfast, due to the extra charge. The room was very nice for Europe, lots of space and a nice shower. The breakfast was not good, but because it was free, we felt it was ok to eat it to save some money. We had a great stay until we checked out. There was a different receptionist when we went to check out. I got the bill and noticed there was a charge for the breakfast. I asked about the charge and the tall, skinny, bald man with glasses told us it was not free. We told him the situation that we were given the breakfast and he was extremely rude. He then proceeded to call us "cheeky" as we tried to "sneak" a 4th person in. This was clearly not the case as we all stood at the desk while checking in, and he was not even there at check in. He then told us he could be as rude as he wished. When we went to pay he did not ask and charged us in US dollars...this would have been fine but most people ask if we want Euros or Dollars and the overall rudeness just put us off. This really ruined my entire impression of this hotel. If you stay here, just know to stay away from this guy and there is no consistency in the message at reception.

Reviews.Title: “underated in good location”
Reviews.Author: nan0n
Reviews.Content: Only a couple of minutes walk from Las Ramblas, in a quiet side street, but be wary walking back late at night we were hassled by 2 men, luckily there were 6 of us! ( not in the same street as hotel ) We loved the hotel, the rooms were very roomy, clean and well furnished, didn't notice any noise from other guests, the breakfast was good included in the price, much better than some 3 star hotels we've stayed in. Free internet access We booked a 3 night stay but unfortuantly got caught in the ash cloud crisis and had to stay longer, The staff and management were fantastic, very helpful, we were charged the same price for the extra nights, unusual in extraordinary circumstances, some people we spoke to had their room costs doubled in other hotels and moved to ours! It made difficult circustances easier to deal not being ripped off! would reccommend this hotel, great central location, lots of small cafes nearby

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest Hotel I've stayed in yet : (”
Reviews.Author: Lovely20
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Principal in December 2010 for 5 nights. The hotel was located not too far from la Rambla and la Bocqueria, which was fabulous. The hotel appeared to be clean however I had ants in my room, at first just a few but over the next few days there were more and more. There were facilities for tea and coffee but it would have been great if there was a mini fridge to put perishable items in, particularly when staying a few days and being so close to the markets. Reception staff were uninterested in guests and only when standing directly in front of them at the desk would they acknowledge you. Not very good customer service. By far the worst part was the noisy floors throughout the hotel and the exceptionally noisy ladies in the room beside me. My room was at the end of the corridor and you could hear them from the moment they got off the lift to the moment they slammed their door closed repeatedly each night at all hours, not to mention being able to hear them having conversations in their room. Noisy guests is by no means the fault of the hotel, however, floorboards although they are cleaner than carpet, are noisy and particularly when the doors are paper thin, every single sound can be heard throughout the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: EpicureanLawyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in mid-March 2011 and would be happy to stay here again as long as we aren't looking for luxury. This is a moderately priced hotel and a great value for the money. Its on a small side-street about two blocks from La Rambla, reasonably quiet for this busy part of Barcelona. The lobby and the rooms are clean, unpretentious, comfortable; ours had a small balcony overlooking the street. There are about 4 floors and a terrace on the roof. A small elevator makes moving luggage easy. They had two coin-operated computers in a lounge on the grounnd floor with internet service and printers. They offer breakfast, but we went to the nearby market instead. The location of this hotel makes it an excellent base for exploring Las Ramblas, the Gothic Quarter, and the Mercat de Boqueria on foot. Staff at the desk were courteous and helpful, providing walking maps and advice. When we inquired about car rentals, they even arranged for a rental car to be delivered to us right at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money....”
Reviews.Author: sammy78Dublin
Reviews.Content: Have just returned home today from this hotel and have to say it should definitely be a 3star at leat hotel. This is my second time staying here in 1year and would reccommend it to my frineds. Location was excellent and staff very very friendly Breakfast was lovely and food there to cater for everyone. Will most certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient Hotel with Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Junluved
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel so much. The location is in the middle of downtown and very close to the MRT station but it's at a quite location so it's really perfect. You'll have quiet night but very close to everywhere. Will stay here again if we come back to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Second great stay !”
Reviews.Author: AmyEade
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights 17 - 20th December. Room 412 was a good sized superior double with a double and a single bed. Big bathroom with a large shower but no bath. Small balcony to the front and another one by the door which overlooked grotty internal courtyard. 419 was huge with two double beds, two double balconies and a sofa that could be another bed. Another big bathroom but a half bath with a shower attachment. Location gets better the more we stay. Really easy to get to everywhere especially Barri Gottic across the Rambalas and straight up to the Cathedral. Metro stop very close (3 stops up to Diagonal for Guadi's buildings. It's a 15v minute walk down to Port Vell. Lovely resturant directly opposite hotel that does vegan/vege food. Sounds horrid but after a plane ride of eating rubbish it was lovely to have nicely cooked vegetable dishes and rice. Even better they do take away and gave us their cutlery so we could eat in our room (very delayed flight). Two doors down is a brilliant supermarket that is massive and has lots of nice stuff to take back as presents. Good supermarkets are quite hard to find within an easy walk of La Rambalas. Perhaps because we've been a few times we found it not the least bit threatening. Also there are loads of shops with much better prices than other areas of town if you want a bit of tourist tat,scarves, cheap fashion jewellery etc. Still like the beer and snacks from vending machine in lobby (although 2 euros a can now!) Much better idea than pricey mini bar. Didn't want to come home!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Barcelona! Safe, Clean, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: billlane5200
Reviews.Content: I spent hours researching hotels for this trip and it really paid off! The location is 2 short blocks off Las Ramblas in the heart of the historic district. Hotels directly on LR may seem convenient but the nightlife continues into the wee hours (3AMor later) and the noise can be a real drawback. The staff is fluent in English, amiable and quite helpful in every way. The room wasn't spacious but perfectly adequate. The view wasn't ! We laughed when we open the drapes to see a small shaft about 12' x 20' of nieghbors' crumbling verandas, clotheslines, and damp decaying stucco walls. The buildings ARE over 100 years old and the facades are well cared for but the hotel can't be expected to require the neighbors to maintain their properties.The shower took some getting used to!

Reviews.Title: “Great offer for a 2-star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MortenTKKristensen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in end-October 2010 - arrived at 10:30am but was accessed emmidiatly to our 4th floor room. English speakling staff at the front desk - very friendly. Room was wide and open with two balconees(small but opens up nicely), great bathroom with all needed facilites. Small, old flatscreen tv got fixed emmidiatly upon complaint, bad was large and comforting, but we will never get use to the "envelopes" of sheets and blankets of southern europe :-). Breakfeast was plenty and the (too) swift for comfort but there is everything you will need. The hotel is very clean everywhere, service polite and to the guests attention - what more can you ask for at a 2-star hotel. The souronding area is quite suspecious, but feels safe. Cant blame the hotel for that. Close to the Las Ramblas, but for God's stay away from this area! The further away you get from the Rambla, the better/cheaper/cosier it gets - literally!! Love Barcelona, and would definitly stay at Hotel Principal again if available :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, convenient to everything”
Reviews.Author: Runs262
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple who we frequently travel with, stayed at the Hotel Principal for 4 nights. The good: extremely convenient location - great for walking or taking Metro, getting a cab. Especially convenient for the two of us who run since we easily did our daily miles out to and around the beach. Rooms were adequate - we did ask to switch from the first room they gave us which had two single beds and we had reserved a room with a double. That was easily taken care of.. The not especially impressive part of our stay: we had chosen this hotel based, to a large extent, on the favorable reviews on Trip Advisor including the frequent mentions of the pleasant and gracious staff. We did not experience this at all --- the persons working at the front desk barely raised their heads to return our morning "Hola" and when we did ask them a question (re: time to leave for getting back to airport) - the person at the desk had no advice to offer... nothing. The staff in the breakfast dining area seemed harried and perhaps annoyed that the people dining there seemed to be in their way -- which was sort of odd given that it wasn't terribly crowded and the guests didn't appear to be asking for any special services. I realize that this is not a reason not to recommend a particular hotel, however , our experience here was so different from the interactions we had with the staff at our hotel in Madrid -- The RoomMate Laura, that I wanted to mention it here. Overall, the location (and quiet given it's proximity to La Rambla) is the reason I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the right price”
Reviews.Author: JAH2008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this hotel on Trip Advisor. We are not too fussy about rooms. We were much more concerned with location and value. This place had both. It was very conveniently located a couple blocks from La Rambla and right around the corner from Mercat de la Boqueria. We would head over there to get fresh fruit for breakfast every morning. As for amenities, the room was a good size for two people. We sprung for a room with a balcony, which was nice to have but not large enough to sit on. The bathroom was also better than expected. My only complaint about the room was the mattress, which was very hard. There is also a nice roof deck, which - sadly - we did not find until the end of our stay. Overall a great option for travelers looking for value.

Reviews.Title: “Very central and perfectly acceptable for the price”
Reviews.Author: Staighed
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine. The rooms are clean and the facilities more than adequate. It's just a few minutes walk from the Ramblas. The breakfast, like the hotel overall, is good value. Although a few other travellers have complained about the location it's no different from the rest of the centre of Barcelona - there are a few poor and/or untogether people around. Such travellers will find most of Europe a disappointment - we have much lower levels of poverty and inequality than they do at home but we haven't (yet) segregated the poor where they cannot be seen...

Reviews.Title: “About the best 2 star hotel you could find ...”
Reviews.Author: zephiedog
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean and bright - 2 balconies (it was a superior room) and twin beds that were each as big as a small double. I found the beds very comfortable and slept well. Even though we were at the front of the notel noise was not a problem. Sheets were fresh and clean. The air conditioning was quick and effective and easy to operate. The decor was minimal - nice curtains, and paintwork was fine. The bathroom was modern and pleasant. However, the shower over the bath was not quite right. There was a huge shower head through which the water came - and the water was always nice and hot with a good flow - but it also poured out of the tap at the same time - it was not possible to switch the tap off. There was also a handheld showerhead which didn't seem to work. We thought the breakfast was pretty good - the usual buffet - but plenty of choice and even some very nice cake. The downsides were some of the reception staff seemed rather uninterested and brusque - but others were fine and pleasant. Finally, the area is not posh - it's very close to the wonderful market (try the fish and seafood platter for 2 for 39 euros!) - but the street is a bit dirty and could put off those a little worried about being out at night on their own. It didn't worry us as we have lived in quite rough areas in London and Manchester. Perhaps a woman on her own would prefer a more upmarket area. As for all the stories about pickpockets working in gangs - we saw nothing like this fortunately - perhaps they don't bother in September - but there seemed to be lots of police around - especially on the Ramblas. There are some beggars around the town, but not that many - and there are some sad looking individuals, as there are in any city, struggling to make a living off the tourists. However, we never felt worried and really enjoyed the city and our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Local taxi driver advised us to move to another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pink-camera
Reviews.Content: 2 star hotel with horrible attitude. It's located in the most dangerous area in Barcelona! Lots of prostitutes, vandalism, homeless people and drug addicts even during the day time around this hotel. It's not safe. We traveled in Europe for 3 weeks and stayed at many different hotels. This was the worst. Check-in time is 2 pm, not 1 pm like it says on the website. Receptionists were totally horrible and rude to us. When we arrived at 1 pm, we were told "I don't mind if you want to check in to a room that is dirty and hasn't cleaned yet" by the very rude receptionists. I won't stay there for even $1000. You can find 4 star hotels at cheaper price in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Mercat Boqueria, very reasonable option”
Reviews.Author: cmr42London
Reviews.Content: In the El Raval district, good location near Las Ramblas and the wonderful Mercat St Josef Boqueria. Despite being in a relatively central location, noise was not a problem at all - the sound proofing must be quite good! Room had reasonable beds, although slightly on the firm side. Rooms had all the regular features like kettle, air-con (v. effective), bathroom (!), TV with CNN and World News, but a great feature that came with our room was the small balcony which provided a nice relaxation spot in the early mornings and late at night. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and we had no problems with anything. Myself and my husband didn't have breakfast in the hotel as the market selling cheap fruit and bread was so close by. We did however use the internet services, which were priced very reasonably. There were also a number of interesting newspapers and travel books in the communal lounge areas, adding to the interesting nature of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, value, and location”
Reviews.Author: Cust0mer0
Reviews.Content: Hotel Principal was a very pleasant experience. It is almost on the Ramblas right on the opposite side from the cathedral, but on a quite sidestreet with a couple of rather upscale restaurants and a small hole-in-the-wall bar on the corner. There were always lot's of people eating and drinking and talking outside, so I never felt in danger or anything, and the noise didn't reach my room. The latter was exceptionally clean with a very big bathroom (scarce in Europe), probably very recently renovated because it was unblemished and looked very new. And all these for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Very Clean - Good quality for a two star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bytheway2001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a side street just metres from the main busy area of Las Ramblas. It has a lovely rooftop terrace for a bit of sunbathing weather permitting of course. The rooms all have air conditioning that works fine, you can leave it on when you are out so that on your return from a busy hot day you will come back to a lovely cool room. Nice modern bathroom with hydromassage shower or a bathtub. There is also a hairdryer. Towels & bed sheets changed every day and rooms were clean and decent quality decor too. Stopped here for 3 nights and found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Breakfast was okay to with the usual cereals, Fresh Orange, Continental meats and cheese etc. There was also a choice of hot food fried eggs or scrambled, bacon although the usual spanish more fat than bacon. Sausages were not English more like hot dogs. Overall though I thought the choice was good and as much as you could eat too. There is also a 24-hour reception desk. Pity there is no bar though. I would not hesitate to stop here again because of its location to La Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: mlove17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling through Europe on our honeymoon, and consider ourselves to be "budget travelers." We don't expect much for the lower prices we choose to pay, as we're more about seeing Europe than staying in luxury hotels. However, upon coming to Barcelona, we realized that we were going to need to splurge a bit on a hotel for our enjoyment and safety (after all, it was our honeymoon), and thought that the Hotel Principal looked nice from its website photos and also seemed to be a "decent" price (90 euros) if we agreed to pay in advance and book ahead. It was, ironically enough, the only hotel that we didn't research ahead of time on TripAdvisor, as we decided at the last minute to visit Barcelona on our travels. To say that our experience with Hotel Principal was disappointing would be an understatement. Upon arriving to the room and the hotel in general, had we not already paid in advance (to our sadness), we would have walked out the door and found someplace way better. The walk from the metro station to the hotel took us down dirty alley streets smelling of garbage and urine, graffitied buildings, party hostels and bars, before we finally found the Hotel Principal. The attendant checking us in promptly informed us of the pickpocketers of Barcelona, and how to fend of an attack if necessary. He also told us not to stay out late at night in order to be safer on the streets coming back to the hotel. I was a little freaked out by this, as I'd never had a hotel clerk greet me with this kind of a warning before. When we came to our room, it was completely BARE minimum. The sheets were incredibly scratchy (complete with hairs on them-- thank you very much), you could feel the springs through the bed, there were stains on the walls, and the floors creaked from the plastic-y hardwood. The hotel also had a weird system where you had to put your room key in a slot on the wall to turn the lights on in the room, but this system also lit up a red light outside your door, letting everyone know when you were and were not present in your room. That was super weird and we were not at all comfortable with that indicator. We hid our possessions just in case. We skipped out of breakfast and were glad we did so, because they charged an outrageous price. The hotel thankfully had free wireless internet, and the other guests all seemed to be of more an adult caliber, which was nice. It was honestly nothing more than a glorified hostel. And really, if we only paid 30 euros a night for the room I would totally not be complaining-- you get what you paid for. But 90 euros??? We saw MUCH better places for 90 euros around the city, but were stuck at our hotel due to pre-payment. When we told them that we wanted to be upgraded since it was our honeymoon, they said, "sorry, we're fully booked" which was completely untrue. We were very disappointed in the service we received at the hotel. I kind of felt sorry for the workers though-- working there would bring my morale down also. It is completely NOT worth the money, and it really makes me mad that their website advertisements make it seem much more glamorous and spacious than it really was. It was also in the part of town that every guidebook tells you to avoid. Yes it was close to the Ramblas, but that street isn't much to rave about either. It's filled with weird carnival mimes doing awkward things, people shoving you to buy things, and drunk people most of the time. We preferred the Olympic Village area and places not so 'downtown.' I would definitely stay in a different area if we ever visit Barcelona again (which is unlikely). Avoid this place if you want a better hotel for your money!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmgale
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the day that Spain won the World Cup... what a celebration. The Hotel Principal is situated just off Las Ramblas - in a quiet street. Loved it as soon as we walked in...very friendly staff.. lovely rooms ..sunny roof terrace..breakfast served until 10.30 with plenty of choice. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms - Icky Street”
Reviews.Author: SanSouci_travel
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself feels very modern - with a modern elevator! It offers free computer usage and internet. The rooms were basic but very clean. The bathroom was great, especially in comparison to "American" standards and absolutely beats the "European" standard. With that said, there were some interesting aspects about staying at the hotel. First, when we arrived the receptionist kept mentioning that breakfast was in the main dining room. He gave us the times and said to go there when we woke up. Fast forward to check-out -- breakfast is NOT included and cost 10 euros/day per person. NOT WORTH IT. It was annoying because the entire time it sounded like it was included with our booking. I accept full responsibility for not verifying that information prior to having breakfast, but it still seemed "shady" not to mention it. One general safety issue for me is the knowing/not knowing if people are in their rooms. The hotels all have bright red lights above the doors that turn on when the key is inserted into the space to turn on the electricity. This does not seem safe. Basically a big target that yes, we are in the room. My impression of Barcelona is colored by the concern for my safety. Rick Steves recommends to never venture west of Las Ramblas -- and that is exactly where this hotel is located -- one block west of Las Ramblas. There is graffiti, homeless people, dirty streets, and a ton of people who can "pick" you out as a tourist. I was expecting a grandiose Barcelona, and was severely disappointed by the city. Las Ramblas had tacky tourist/souvenir stores and fast food restaurants. The tapas restaurants hardly had any "true" tapas food. It was not the best area to stay in. To further complicate this issue of safety... We showed our itinerary to the receptionist and verified that we would be safe walking around the city. By the end of our discussion we had five main roads to walk on and lots of mini streets to walk quickly through and avoid if we could. I did not have a good experience in Barcelona and partly colored by the location of the hotel. I would stay in another hotel in a different part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: mschr
Reviews.Content: Very well located. Not too far away from the Rambla and Placa Catalunya, but still away from the tourist masses. Nice and clean and with free wi-fi. No restaurant and the breakfast is not really worth it, but then again - who needs that in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Subpar honeymoon experience - paperthin walls!”
Reviews.Author: viper33
Reviews.Content: So we just got back from our honeymoon in Barcelona, where we booked 3 nights at the Principal. (thankfully followed by 3 nights at the W) The principal was located in a small street just a minute off La Ramblas, which really is the only reason anyone would book here. Location was great. Checked in, saw that the room was a bit cramped - the bed is practically touching the door. But clean. Just a place to sleep at night. good enough for us. So we immediately realize that we can hear every sound coming from the hallway. Everything. the rolling carts, people talking, laughing, doors closing (slamming). We are pretty easygoing so it didn't bother us. After a day full of activities we get back to bed and were watching a TV show on our tiny netbook, and we hear this knocking on our door. I figured it would just go away, the hotel woulndt knock, they would call if they wanted to contact us. Knocking did not stop. so i have to get out of bed, put something on, and answer the door. and it's some hotel clerk telling me that there's a NOISE COMPLAINT!! about us! I was floored. so we just turned it off and went to bed. Needless to say, I slammed the doors extra hard after that one.... Next day, we are getting ready and the water is out. hear that? the water doesnt work! so we called and the hotel calmly mentions, yeah, there's no hot water. we're working on it. That's it. So we are trapped without water for over an hour, and so i called the reception to voice my concerns about the noisy halls and getting ratted out when we're not as loud, and the water outage, and instead of caring for the concern, the guy said "Well. Now you know for next time." and hung up. ha! we actually laughed after that. ridiculous. I would never stay here or recommend it to anyone. Ever.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place.... Just off the Ramblas.... Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: SThakkar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between 18th and 21st May. It is literally a 4 minute walk from the Ramblas, the happening walking street of Barca, and also a 4 minute walk to the subway station - Liceu. The place was nice, clean, bright, with large rooms and clean bathrooms. The best part is, that unlike most hotels of Europe, having a 2nd child in the room was not a problem at all. The staff was efficient, courteous and helpful. From changing to a larger room, directions to a specific place to even lending us a simple wall socket adapter. They never said no. Getting taxis was not a problem from here. The hotel helped out. There was an excellent selection of restaurants and bars, starting from next door. They had free WiFi in the room, and free computers to use in the lobby. We're definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: holidayfan65
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely 3 night stay at this hotel. Bedroom and bathroom were spotless. Breakfast great but if your a coffee drinker not so good! Only down side was the small room we were allocated. Did mention a move to a bigger room as we were there for 3 nights but they mentioned they had standard and superior rooms at a supplement so we never really found out if we were unlucky with what we were allocated! All in all a good hotel with excelent location. Free internet was handy too

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic budget hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: daisySouthCoast
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real bargain and really punches above its weight. Stayed 4 nights at the end of march, the room was small but adequate although the bathroom was large. Hotel was very clean, towels/linen changed daily, the breakfast was also good - english (bacon,frankfurters,scrambled egg) & continental selection (cold meats,salad etc). The hotel had 3 computers in the foyer with free internet access, it also had vending machines for snacks and drinks. All rooms also have a safe. Even though the rooms were fairly small there was little noise during the night. The location was excellent - only a 2 minute walk from Las Rambla and the tube. Some reviews have mentioned the nearby area being a bit unsafe but we always felt safe even when walking at night - no worse than any other city. Barcelona is apparently the capital of pickpockets but we did not experience this - just be a bit streetwise. We will definitely stay in this hotel when we next return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosie_Little
Reviews.Content: Smallish basic rooms but fantastic location. A few steps away from the Market which is great for breakfast, and right next to the Rambla and onwards to the Barri Gotic. We ended up walking almost everywhere because it was so convenient. Room was clean and comfortable, staff were friendly. We had a balcony which was beautiful and we had no problem with noise despite being there over the weekend. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Hela80
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in a triple room ensuite. Clean, spacious room with small balcony. Nice rooftop terrace. Breakfast buffet for 10 EUR per day. The hotel is conveniently situated close to La Rambla and the Market La Boqueria, still in a quiet neighborhood. Many restaurants nearby. Good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, hard beds”
Reviews.Author: palooja
Reviews.Content: The location close to La Ramblas at a quiet neighborhood was great. I agree with the next reviewer about the safety issues. Red sign indicating that you are in your room is great for cleaning purposes but when shut down it also indicates that your room is ready for burglars. The light safe deposit box did not seem so safe at all (about 3 euros a night, if I remember right)! However, the place was alright. Beds in romantic rooms were hard as rock but otherwise rooms were nice and quiet. We even got a bottle of cava for the first night! Free wi-fi functioned perfectly and it was pretty fast. Breakfast was worth of money. If you are not good with mazes, go and stay somewhere else. You almost need a map to find your way to your room!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I'd expected based on other reviews”
Reviews.Author: Estufarian
Reviews.Content: First, the Location is excellent and really quiet considering how close it is to the Ramblas. My main issue is with security - and that left uncomfortable feeling about the place overall. When you are in the room, there is an outside light indication you are there. And obviously the converse is true - if you're away from the room, then the light is out. While that may help the staff, my concern was that anybody with 'bad intentions' would know which rooms are empty - and hence I was concerned about an increased risk of break-in. Accordingly I felt it imperative to store valuables - which entailed an extra $3 euro charge per day. Still worth it to protect my passport etc - but i don' t recall EVER having to pay extra for a safe in any other hotel. Free wi-fi didn't work in room, but was fine in lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.... fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: corkcoupleIreland
Reviews.Content: Just back from a prolonged stay in Barca.... stayed in this hotel from 10th - 16th April.... very clean hotel, buffet breakfast great.... our flight was cancelled on 16th due to volcanic ash... the hotel were unable to put us up for a longer stay but they phoned several hotels nearby to see if they could find us a room and even dismissed hotels that were charging too much... eventually they found the Hesperia Ramblas and even the guy on the desk walked us to this hotel to show us where it was. I think this was above and beyond the call of duty and must thank him most profoundly. We are now home after a weeks extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Ohwheretonext
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Prinicipal and were more than satisfied It's about a 3-4 minute walk at most from Las Ramblas despite being down a narrow street so it's location is ideal. It's spotlessly clean and comfortable with good breakfasts from 7.30-10.30 with choice of usual hot & cold dishes. We had a kettle in the room with teabags & sugar but no coffee or milk (in case you want to go prepared!) Room 114 had no outlook whatsoever but we were able to change to 324 which had a little balcony - again the view is interesting rather than spectacular! Room 114 had a space age looking shower but no bath, whereas 324 had shower over bath - again all spotlessly clean. I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel again! Taxi from airport Fri night 25 euros, taxi to airport 8am Mon 42 euros!

Reviews.Title: “They did not charge us when we couldn't cancel reservation in 24 hours”
Reviews.Author: WestVirginiaBirdmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had plans to stay at this hotel on a recent vacation, but our flights were all cancelled from the United States due to bad weather. We had booked a reservation on the website with the full knowledge of "no shows" being charged one nights fee. We did not plan on being a "no show" since we were headed on a cruise the next day. Due to the time zone differences and us being in transit, we were unable to cancel this reservation with 24 hours notice when our flights were cancelled. I sent an email to the hotel, explained our situation, and they emailed back that they would not charge us as a "no show". I was very pleased and thought this was an excellent gesture by the hotel. I will definitely stay with them in the future if I find myself in Barcelona, Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt have asked for more for this price...”
Reviews.Author: Neetu_anand
Reviews.Content: We seriously hadnt expected such a wonderful room at such a low price.. it wasnt luxurious.. but who wants that when u are out to see the beautiful city in the day... but u want to come back to a comfortable bed and a clean room and bathroom... the linen, towels was clean... daily cleaning done... towels changed daily... room was indeed small but very very comfortable... AND THE LOCATION...was simply perfect...just a 5 min walk from las ramblas that too just the centre of it... both ends are just a few minutes away...the beach and placa catalunya.... v didnt ve the breakfast so cant comment on it... dont think twice, if u r a budget traveler, go ahead and book it... oh ya and u get a tight sleep.. coz i didnt wake up with any noises at night... PEOPLE BE AWARE OF THE PICK POCKETERS ON LAS RAMBLAS... i myself almost got robbed by a lady who seemed like a traveler like me... on d busy street of las ramblas... thank god a shopkeeper saw her and shouted in my direction and she ran away... i panicked and ran away... didnt say thanks to d guy... THANKS if ever u visit this...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: DarDub
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the second time in six months (I was there for one week in late August 09) and must admit it was even better second time around. Huge Double room with balcony, for single use worked out at €71 a night including breakfast. Very central, two minutes from the centre of Ramblas and amongst the hustle and bustle of everything. A lovely charming hotel with lots of character and the front desk staff are excellent. Will definitely return : ).

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What I Was Looking For & A Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Reefwatcher
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small, clean, friendly hotel, conveniently located in the historic center, and at a reasonable price. I got all of that and more with the Hotel Principal. A friend and I shared a room for six nights in mid-February, and we were both completely happy with our hotel choice. The Principal is located just a short walk off the Ramblas. Getting there was easy -- we took the Aerobus from the Barcelona airport (quick, efficient and only five Euros), which deposits passengers at the Placa de Catalunya at the top of the Ramblas. If you aren't overloaded with luggage, it's a pleasant walk from there to the hotel. We were warmly greeted, and were able to check in upon our mid-morning arrival. The twin room was clean and modern, with a generously sized bathroom, comfortable beds, sufficient closet space, in-room safe, phone, small television, and reliable and free WiFi. We had a fourth floor room (yes, there's an elevator), with a small balcony overlooking the street. We opted for the convenience of the included breakfast, which was buffet style and more than sufficient, including a nice selection of hot and cold items, and all the coffee or tea you could drink. It was a good value, and we could eat enough to carry us through most of our day -- or until we could no longer resist one of Barcelona's many pastry shops. The hotel also has free and convenient computer access, with three workstations on the ground floor. The front desk was staffed round the clock, and the staff members, all of whom were fluent in English, were terrific at answering questions or making restaurant recommendations. I booked through the hotel's own website; confirmation was quick and efficient, and the website represents the hotel accurately. I give this hotel a strong recommendation, and if I return to Barcelona, I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, relatively reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Suzsen
Reviews.Content: Hotel Principal is located 2 short blocks from the center of Las Ramblas, about halfway down a narrow side street off of Carrer le'Hospital. The neighborhood is a little "iffy" at night but we didn't walk alone and had no trouble. It's at the edge of El Ravel, a neighborhood with a large immigrant population. When our cab brought us to the hotel the driver laughed and said, "Authentico Barcelona!" It's a very short walk to Las Ramblas, and to either the front or back entrance of La Boqueria, the large open-air food market. I found the location perfect for sightseeing, we were maybe a 3 minute walk from the middle of Las Ramblas, near the edge of Bari Gotic, and the L3 line of the Metro (Liceu stop). About 1/2 mile(10 minute walk) from Placa Catalunya. This location is not only convenient for sightseeing, but much quieter than the hotels that are directly on Las Ramblas or Placa Catalunya. The rooms are not especially soundproof (no rugs in rooms or halls) but the hotel was not noisy. The room was spotlessly clean, a decent size with plenty of storage. Bathroom was large. We had 2 small balconies that looked out onto the street and the building across the street (apparently the back of that building). The TV left something to be desired, but who goes to Barcelona to watch TV? Breakfast cost 10 Euros but was plentiful - eggs, sausage, bacon, breads, salad, fruit juice, cereal, coffee & tea. More than a typical European continental breakfast. Its also easy to walk over to La Boqueria and get some bread, fruit, and drinks. The beds are extremely firm, but we like them that way. We were on the 3rd floor, and the WiFi worked well in our room. This hotel cost us 125 Euros per night for Sat and Sun, it jumped to 250/night starting Monday because there was a huge cell phone convention in town. It was the only hotel I could find that had any rooms available for less than 400 Euro/night. But it was such a great location, even with the slightly questionable neighborhood immediately surrounding it, that I'm very glad we stayed there. When we first arrived, we took a cab to the hotel which cost us about 32 Euro. The Aerobus goes roundtrip from Placa Catalunya to the airport from around 6 am to about midnight, its about a 25 minute ride and there were always at least 2 of these buses waiting at Placa Catalunya. It's 5 Euro per person one way. We walked to Placa Catalunya and took the Aerobus on our return to the airport and it was great. We saw MANY people wheeling their luggage to/from the Aerobus along Las Ramblas and in the area around Placa Catalunya. If you go to Barcelona, beware of pickpockets. Our son is a college student there, and used an ATM on Placa Catalunya in the middle of the day. Two teenage girls shoved a clipboard in his face asking him to sign something just after he hit the "get cash" button. He knocked the clipboard away quickly, but by the time he realized they had grabbed his cash as the machine dispensed it, they were gone. On our trip we saw two kids, maybe 12 years old, with the same clipboards, loitering near the same ATM.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling clean and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Eldonley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from 5 night's stay at the Hotel Principal; it is excellent. The room was one of the best we have ever stayed in - balcony, very clean bathroom with good shower as well as bath, huge and very comfortable bed and (less common these days) tea making facilities. Breakfasts were first class - massive choice of good quality food. The hotel is isdeally situated, just off La Rambla andnear to all major attractions. This is a 2* hotel, so it's not plush but thick carpets can hide a multitude of sins! Dave and Sally, Portsmouth, England

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay!!!!!!!! would go again for sure”
Reviews.Author: jackie17_7
Reviews.Content: we were really happy that we found this hotel. the service was perfect and the staff were friendly too. we were a group 0f 7 and had 1 triple room and 2 double rooms which were ideal, very clean, spacious and comfortable. my husband had his birthday while we were there and the hotel sent us an unexpected bottle of cava and a happy birthday note in the room which was much appreciated. the breakfast was more than we epected and everything was fresh. there was cold cuts, hot items, pastries, yoghurts, cakes, cerals bread etc coffee juices chocolate etc the location was ideal centrally located just a few meters away from the rambas metro station and the shops, it was a good base to go roud the city there was no mini fridge in the rooms but there are vending machines next to the lift before going up to the rooms. internet was available 24 hours at no extra charge. it was a nice experience, we are thinking of going to barcelona again and will definitevely book this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, in great location, great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: CHALKIE-7
Reviews.Content: this is the second time we have stayed at this hotel and as of three years ago we found it again to be excellent. the hotel is 2 minutes from the rambalas. rooms are very clean and modern, with tea making facilities and wall mounted lcd tv. the inclusive buffet all you can eat breakfast was a joy with a choice of cerals, cold meats etc, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, fried tomato, croissants, cakes. the hotel is amazing in so far that there are loads of pictures in the bedrooms and all over the building, even on the ceiling in the breakfast room.28 euros taxi fare from the airport took 20-25 mins.fully recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located”
Reviews.Author: RGRhodes
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Principal is located 2 blocks from the Liceu Metro Station mid way up Las Ramblas. The triple room was very large and clean as was the bath. The breakfast was delicious and plentiful. There is no dinning room for other meals but plenty of restaurants near by. Several of the reviews commented on the neighborhood but I (72 years old) never felt uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frinkeyfrog
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Principle hotel, the location was excellent, just 2 streets from La Ramblas and just around the corner from the markets. The nearest metro station ( Leucio) was less than 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Breakfast was fine-a choice of cereal, toast, crossiants, jams, fresh juice, tea, coffee, full english breakfast if desired too, all included in the price. Beautiful city, lots to see- we got a metro/bus/train pass for 5 days and that only cost 23 euros each. Was great to get around the city with. Just one thing- beware of the pick pockets- we were caught out before we'd even reached the hotel to check in! - Luckily for us, undercover police caught them red handed and we got everything back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - but go for a Superior Room if staying more than 1 night”
Reviews.Author: CAB71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights Aug 30-September 3, as part of a trip through Spain and France. I definitely agree with the other reviewers about the location - its great. Very close to La Rambla (2 minute walk down a nice street) but far enough away that its quiet for sleeping. Its also very close to the Market, which is a definite must-see if visiting Barcelona. There's also a parking garage across the street from the hotel, but I don't know if there are any discounts associated with being a guest at the hotel. I found the hotel to be clean, and pretty modern on the inside, and appears to have been very recently renovated/refurbished. My wife also liked it, and she can be fussy about this kind of thing, so that's a good sign. We stayed in a superior room with a terrace. Our room was quite large (especially by European standards) with two twin beds put together, rather than a Queen (not unusual in Europe), with a couch, flat screen TV, and a good sized closet and bathroom, as well as a terrace, overlooking the street. I've seen the standard rooms and there is a BIG difference - especially considering they're not that much cheaper than the superior rooms. The hotel has 3 computers with internet access that are free for guests to use, and a breakfast area that serves a standard hotel breakfast (its fine if its included in your room rate, but probably not worth buying if its not). Hotel Staff was friendly enough - they don't go out of their way, but they're not rude either, which is fine with me. Its not a 5 star hotel, after all. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay - I have no complaints with the place. Great location, nice, clean and modern, reasonably priced for the location. It is not a 2 star hotel - its not priced like a 2 star and the rooms and amenities are definitely 3 star quality at a minimum. I would recommend the hotel for sure, but with the proviso that if you're staying for more than 1 night or 2, opt for the bigger room - its just more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, clean, not the best decor”
Reviews.Author: WanderLSP
Reviews.Content: The staff was nice, the breakfast was great and it was clean. It also has a very good location. The decor and feel of the hotel was more like a hostel, but it was much more expensive than a hostel. So, I just didn't see the value. If it was cheaper, I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Belle370
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to the center of action; but off the main street, so it was quiet. Three computers in the lobby for internet access. Wifi did not work in my room, but I saw others with their laptops in the lobby area. Vending machines are convenient for snacks. Good AC in the room. Breakfast was adequate- cereal, bread & jam, coffee & juice, and some hot items too. I would stay here again for the equivalent of about $100-$115 a night.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel for the price and location, personal wasnt that nice”
Reviews.Author: review30
Reviews.Content: location was good next to la ramblas, dock and beach also to the bus station if you fly from girona airport. dont ask hotel to call you taxi its more expensive. personal working there wasnt nice, misleading information and after having a problem with room since the air conditioning broke and the room was full of water we didnt get any sorry had to wait and ask 3 times if we can get a new room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Europeisbest
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 2 minutes walk from the Rambla and underground station. The hotel is extremely central to all of the major Barcelona sites. Ensure that you visit the market which is just to the left as you walk from the hotel to the Rambla. Excellent for fruit, meats for a lunch etc. There is a small supermarket and self service laundy within 30 meters of the hotel entrance which is most useful. (Lookout for pickpockets - normally young women who pretend to be lost tourists, especially on the Rambla and tube trains)

Reviews.Title: “close to the action”
Reviews.Author: DohaShredder
Reviews.Content: The Principal is located just off the main high street - la rambla. It's just a few minutes away from the subway station, and around a 12 minute walk away from the airport shuttle bus station. Only thing I'll say about the location is that most the alleys off la rambla can be quite creepy and lonely at night, so I wouldn't advise a solo female traveller to return to the hotel late at night. As for the rooms, YOU MUST DEMAND a big room at check in, otherwise they will give you a tiny room. When I arrived the management gave me an extremely small room, but at the sametime of check in, another couple were also checking in. They were given a room next to me, and caught a glimpse of it when they opened their door. . .it was much bigger and nicer. I went to reception and demanded a better room, and after a some strong words, they gave me a better room. The new room was spacious, it had a big bed, wooden flooring and it was clean. Only complaint was the sofa, it was a bit worn out. The bathroom was modern and clean asw ell. The hotel also offered free internet in the lobby which was very convenient. So overall, for 50 euros per night, I think its worth staying at the principal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Clean and nice big bed”
Reviews.Author: irishchica
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel from 17th july until 20th July. I stayed in room 529 and had the deal from their website - romantic room. Bathroom is a little on the small side but modern and enough room for all you need. The room was nice with air conditioning. The bed was big with enough space for about 4 adults in it. Only downsides which wasnt really a factor: no room view, but that worked in our favour for peaceful nights sleep. The TV had a handful of english channels (600 satellite tv and about 3 english i could find (channel 24, 34 & 164 ;) ). The breakfast was included in our rate which was yummy. Plenty of fresh fruit, salad and hot food and fruit juices. The little bonus is when we paid the night before the lady said that we had a late check out until 3pm included in the room which we didnt know about. Was great as we werent due to go to the airport until 6pm. The hotel has a great location. A 5 minute walk from las ramblas / placa de catalunya. 10 minute walk from the beach. Restaurants & Bars galore around. I didnt really enjoy anywhere I ate as i didnt research but i tried the american grill on the corner of la ramblas and our hotel street and also the italian restaurant a few doors up. The market beside the hotel is great though. Nicest pineapple Ive ever had. I would def go back to this hotel. Clean, modern, spacious, free wifi, good price and best of all perfect location. Hope this review helps others :)

Reviews.Title: “Surely more than a 2 Star!”
Reviews.Author: iamFloyd
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth time to Barcelona as I go to the Sonar Festival. I prefer to stay close to the Ramblas and Raval district as everything I need from the festival to nightlife are close by. This is the best hotel i've stayed in so far. Close to the Ramblas and just off the beaten track enough not to be too noisy. Great value for a 2 star hotel. I've stayed in other 3 star hotels home and abroad and this beats them all in my opinion. I'm going back next year and staying there again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: toots347
