Reviews.Content: We read all we could and, despite some negative comments, picked this hotel. A really good choice. Just off La Rambla, the hotel was spotless as was the room. The air con was really appreciated and not very noisy. The front desk staff were polite and helpful. Some people said they had been unwelcoming but we thought they were just very professional. The buffet breakfast was just what you would find in such an hotel, nothing fantastic but a good range of all you needed and plenty of it. The sun terrace was appreciated for a quiet sit with a book in the evening before going out. We have been told that La Rambla and the surrounding area is a little "dodgy" for pickpockets and so on but we saw and had no problems. I would suppose that if you are aware of your surroundings then you will have no problems. By the way, watch out for some extortionate prices for coffee, beer etc on the Rambla. If we had a criticism, the free Internet access for the guests was very unreliable and/or really slow. Seemed to need constant resetting by the hotel staff. Some younger guests think sitting at the terminals for hours cruising Facebook is acceptable. But that's life and not a hotel problem!

Reviews.Title: “Suited us perfectly!”
Reviews.Author: RuthBUK
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed here before, a few years ago, and was happy to return. But a bonus was the fact that the hotel has had a make-over and our room was wonderful! Huge space, two windows, each with a balcony, gorgeous bathroom, a very generously-sized single bed each - and a kettle and tea bags which I don't expect in Spanish hotels. The sofa (bed) was also very comfortable for sitting watching the flat-screen TV. The staff on reception (never the same person twice!) were all very friendly and accommodating. They even helped us out when we mistakenly bought a bottle of wine that wasn't screw top :-) The room was cleaned thoroughly and all the towels replaced on each day of our 4 day stay. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel so I can't comment on that. Previous reviewers have mentioned the "iffy" neighbourhood. If, on leaving Las Ramblas, you use Carrer de Hospitale you will find it much less intimidating than the next road down (Carrer de Sant Pau) which isn't very well lit. The location, we found, was perfect: about halfway between Placa de Catlunya and the Port. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: claredale
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this hotel at all... The location is only a couple of minutes walk to the Ramblas and the nearest Metro. The area that it is located is new and upcoming with a great atmosphere and some cool bars/ restaurants nearby. The room was spotlessly clean and had a nice balcony view onto the street. We were on the 4th floor and it was completely quiet at nice. lovely staff who were very helpful and good breakfast. oh and free internet too! would definately recommend and stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Deserves 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: OsloViking
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a small street a couple of blocks from the Rambla. The area is perhaps not Barcelona's best (next door there is both a red cross centre and a pentacost church!), but that did not bother us. In any case, as a tourist in Barcelona you are sure to walk into all kinds of neighboorhoods. Our room was small, but comfortable and clean. Peaceful (window into an empty atrium), but soundproofing to corridor was far from satisfactory as even small sounds entered through the door. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great for a 2-star hotel. I was surprised that this hotel is rated as 2-star, as service and comfort was identical to a 3-star hotel one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Not for lone female travellers!”
Reviews.Author: Debstraveller
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was very close to the Ramblas it was also bordering the Raval area (the Raval area it would seem does not have a great reputation) which felt quite seedy, dirty and prone to the odd vagrant or two. I didn't feel particularly safe going out at night because of this and as a result stayed in for two of the four night stay. The hotel was basic and although pricey I expected more, with a restful lounge/bar area where I could sit and read/relax rather than in my room. There was a seating/internet area which will appeal to some and some vending mchines for snacks/drinks, (the restaurant only serves breakfast from 7.30am - 10.30am) but the seating area was nothing more than a few basic chairs and tables in what was essentially the corridor area to the lift. A bar would have been a plus. Beware of ordering a taxi from the reception as I was charged an additional 9.50 euros when I came to pay the taxi driver at the airport on top of the 25 euros fare, which he stated was a booking fee for the hotel which I was not warned about. The Aerobus to/from the airport departs/drops off at the Plaza Catalunya and costs 4.25 euros each way, and one stop on the tube is 1.35 euros, although with not such heavy cases you could walk to the plaza and save a taxi/tube fare! Recommended sights - City bus tours, cable car from Montjuic, a coffee in the cafeteria at the top of El Corte Ingles for the spectacular views, the promenade for drinks/tapas (bit pricey though) in front of the History Musuem. The restaurant at the top of the History Museum offers a menu for 10 euros including starter/main/drink/sweet & coffee (lunchtime only). Given the prices outside on the waterfront at circa 7 euros for a large beer this is good value. The National Museum of Art is worthwhile visiting. Taller de Tapas in Plaza St Joseph Oriel and Bar Del Pi in PLaza de Pi are great for the beer/tapas, they are plazas adjoining each other. Everything was expensive being in a big city/because of the exchange rate so bring plenty of spends!

Reviews.Title: “Price and location could not be better”
Reviews.Author: vic_eloise
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in march with my husband. I found the hotel by looking on tripadvisor and have to say for the price I would not stay anywhere different. We booked through the hotel website and paid £62 a night which for a city I thought was very reasonable. The service was good, we arrived at the hotel at 10.30 expecting just to leave our bags but our room was ready so we were able to unpack straight away. Also we booked a double room but we actually got a family room which was quite large. The room was at the front of the hotel but in our 5 nights there I never heard any noise. I know some people have commented about the area but we never had any trouble and always felt safe. It may be what you are use to. It was 5 minutes walk from the market and La Rambla so location was great. Obviously with the price its not a top end hotel but if you just want somewhere to put your head at night this place is perfect. Plus it leaves you with money to spend on all the great things to do in Barcelona. We would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad location”
Reviews.Author: HappyCouple_Somerset
Reviews.Content: Value for money considering Barcelona's overpriced hotels, but way too expensive in comparison with most other cities I've visited. BUT the location is on the wrong side of the Rambla - a friend who lives in the city called it "the dangerouse area". (bag snatching and petty crime) and could NOT possibly be described as a hidden gem, it's somewhere to sleep & eat breakfast. Although there is a significant police presence day and night, and the "only" crime we saw was drug dealing, it's a somewhat seedy area and one that many certainly would not wish to walk through after dark or late at night. It's a 5 minute walk from the Rambla, but turn left out of the hotel, if you go right you'll end up in a maze of small alleyways. I would not recommend to a friend. The hotel is refurbished with good quality rooms and excellent showers, but the best rooms are at the back (where we were for 3 nights), because it's quiet. We spent 1 night at the front and this was noisy enough for us to lose quite a bit of sleep with rubbish collection in the small hours and other intrusive noises. During our first stay we were both bitten twice by ?mozzies? but found a very few ants in the room - surprising for the 3rd floor. "Refreshments" in the room consist of a kettle 2 small cups (no spoons), and only 2 weak tea bags and no milk - bring your own tea, coffee, sugar and spoons & buy milk from the supermarket 20 metres down the road!! Breakfast is very comprehensive as it should be for EU 9.50 each!! TV worked fine if you're Spanish, French or Italian. Occassonally CNN worked. No fridge, no mini-bar Fairly sure we would NOT stay there again because of the location, but where else would one stay at this price? To be honest 4 nights in Barcelona was enough for us, we prefer the country!!

Reviews.Title: “I think it is a very bad thing if your room's key card does not work”
Reviews.Author: benFinland
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was excellent and the room (429) was big, quiet and nice. Although the door key card did not work (3 times) and every time we had to go down and up again to get help. The safety box key was lost in the first day and the new key was made so the safety box did not seem quite safe to us. The staff was not sorry at all about those things.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Gill1972
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the Hotel Principal with my boyfriend. The location is great only 2 min to La Rambla and around 5 Minutes to the Plaza Catalunya. On arrival the reception staff were very friendly and most helpful. The room was very comfortable and clean. We especially liked the fact that the Hotel offers unlimited free internet access to its guests. Our deal included breakfast, there was a wide selection of food on offer. It was my birthday during our stay. The maid must of noticed some birthday cards in the room, as a complimentary bottle of bubbly arrived to our room that evening, which I thought was a really nice touch. Overall we could not fault the hotel and would not hesistate to stay there again. During our stay in Barcelona we purchased a 2 day pass for the Bus Touristic, it costs 27 euro but was well worth it. I would recommend a vist to Parc Gruell and the Nou Camp. The port is also very picturesque. Due to the poor exchange rate eating out and drinking were fairly expensive. Some of the Irish Bars were charging 9.50 euro for a glass of wine and a beer. However, you could get the same drinks for around 4.50 in the more traditional Spanish bars in the Gothic Quarter. On the last night we did manage to find an Irish Bar that had a Happy Hour for most of the night, where we paid 5 euro per round.

Reviews.Title: “Second time around - and still great”
Reviews.Author: Jen1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel back in 2007 - and thought it was brilliant. We have now travelled back and spent a long weekend there again - and I have to say that nothing has changed! The hotel had recently been refurbished when we stayed in 2007, but the hotel has been really well looked after. The rooms aren't huge, but then we weren't planning on spending much time in them! The bathroom was great - and all so lovely and clean. The one thing that would have been nice was to have had more English speaking channels on TV (other than CNN). I know we spent very little time watching, but at the end of a very tiring day, it would have been nice to have laid in bed and watched something a little bit interesting. The location, as has been mentioned by lots of other reviewers, can't be beaten. Two minutes from La Rambla. Would I go there again? Yes I would.

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel with 4 star room”
Reviews.Author: AmyEade
Reviews.Content: My partner and I and four year old usually like to stay at 4 star hotels. However after booking cheap flights we found that we had booked one of the busiest weeks in Barcelona and all the hotels were full or had doubled their prices. Hotel Principal was the only well rated hotel with vaccancies so I booked it with trepidation (red light area anyone). The hotel is indeed down an obviously less loved side street but it still had an impressive square and an old church amongst the sculking youths and kebab shops. The hotel looks 2 star and is massive with a maze of very boring tile corridors with bright orange varnished doors.It's obviously been done up recently though and is clean throughout. We had room 529 the first night with its (fake) grey brick wall. We had requested an extra bed and they put one in free of charge.Good points were the flat screen TV, cosy feel and the most emormous double bed I have ever slept in .Perfect for amourous couples or in our case sharing a bed with a small child. Bad points were no view and the trendy frosted glass bathroom door that had a clear inch gap all around it. No privacy at all and I had to request a change of room . I saw some of the other rooms being cleaned and some did look on the small side so we asked to see the room first which the staff were fine about. I asked for a balcony room and were shown round 329. Fantastic room for three star and better then some four star ones. Large and bright with two balconies and french doors. A double sofa that could turn into two beds and a big bathroom with huge mirror. It was well decorated and clean. Flat screen TV and a radio built into the bedhead. Amazing value for a bit over 100 euros. Theres no mini bar but vending machines downstairs do cans (including beer) for 1 euro or 1.50 for bottles of water and theres a coffee machine and snacks as well much cheaper and less disappointing than many mini bars! Free wi fi in one of the lobby rooms with power points for laptops and 3 computers for guest use. Our 100 euros included breakfast which was a ok buffet affair and had lots of choice. The other gusets seemed to be a proper mix of young old and families and all seemed happy.

Reviews.Title: “Really central for La Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: poorpensioner
Reviews.Content: A budget hotel , good value for money included breakfast. Location is strong point being only 100 metres from centre of La ramblas

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trailfinder
Reviews.Content: A superb good value hotel with excellent facilities. The staff were all very helpful and our room had a double balcony. Breakfast was included on our deal and it was much more than we expected. The hotel is very close to the Ramblas but is in a quiet side street. The hotel was quiet at night as was the street outside. Has to be one of the best hotels we have stayed in on any of our journeys to european cities.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located and inexpensive for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: EricaLynn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Principal for one night, prior to departure on a cruise. Knowing that we had so little time in Barcelona, we didn't intend to waste much of it in our room so it didn't make sense to splurge, and location was a priority to optimize what we could see during our short stay. While I probably would not choose this hotel for a longer stay, it was virtually perfect for our needs, especially considering that it was by far the cheapest non-hostel option available to us at the time. Definitely check the hotel's website for specials. Hotel Principal was about a ten-minute walk from the Aerobus stop at Placa de Catalunya. (Be sure you have an old-fashioned map or directions, as the crowded nature of the area meant our GPS unit had trouble finding a signal.) Cabs were readily available in the plaza for those who would prefer not to walk. We were somewhat concerned we'd look out of place trudging around with our suitcases, but many others on the street were also clearly tourists en route to local hotels. Hotel Principal is only a couple of blocks off La Rambla, which we thought was great because it meant the benefits of the location without the crowds and noise of the main drag (and we had no interest in touristy La Rambla itself anyway). The hotel's neighborhood didn't make us feel any less comfortable than anyplace else we went in Barcelona - we never felt particularly uncomfortable anywhere - but we weren't out past midnight, so I can't comment on the area late at night. There were a decent number of other people, sufficient lighting, and several restaurants/storefronts...it certainly didn't have a "back alley" feel or anything. The front desk staff spoke English and were friendly at check-in. Our room was on the second floor. We used the elevator (painfully slow - there's only one tiny elevator for the entire hotel!) to bring our bags up to our room but subsequently used the charming marble staircase for other trips up and down. The room was tiny, with barely enough room for a bed and small dresser. Everything was clean, and the bed was fortunately more comfortable to sleep on than we expected after first sitting on it. The bathroom was actually quite large. Essentially, the accommodations were about the equivalent of an EconoLodge or Motel Six, albeit with a bit more charm. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, as there are many little cafes a short walk from there (as well as La Boqueria market). Just be aware that nothing opens for breakfast until after 8 am - we're morning people and had gone to bed before midnight because of jet lag, so it was a bit of a shock to find that we had the city pretty much to ourselves when we ventured out around 7! As I mentioned, the location was the best part of this hotel. We wandered all over the city (Gothic Quarter, Parc de la Ciutadella, Monument a Colom, Mansana de la Discordia, etc.) and never once needed a cab or public transportation. We did decide to take a cab to our ship, and that was a good choice, as the terminal area was not particularly pedestrian-friendly and was quite a trek from the Columbus monument. Really the only complaint I have about this hotel, taking into account the expectations one should have for a budget hotel, pertains to their luggage holding process. There is a large open area adjacent to the lobby, and that's where guests are instructed to leave luggage as needed. No one watches to see who accesses this room (which doesn't even have a door), there is no claim ticket, and there's nothing to stop people from walking out with any of the luggage in there. Check out time was 10:30, not 11 as was noted on the confirmation materials I received when making the reservation, and we opted not to board our ship until after 3 pm. We didn't want to miss our chance to explore Barcelona, but I would have felt better while doing so if our belongings were a bit safer. That’s the only aspect of our stay that would make me hesitate to book Hotel Principal again for a pre-cruise night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel - Gracias :D :D :D”
Reviews.Author: manhannz
Reviews.Content: If you go to Barcelona, stay at this hotel. GREAT LOCATION (real close to La Rambla), FRIENDLY STAFF, CLEAN ROOM/BATHROOM, GREAT ROOM SERVICE, new lifts and nice interior!! VERY CLEAN! Great Value as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great for being central - and cheap”
Reviews.Author: peeweeLeeds
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just off La Rambla so really handy for getting everywhere. Had seen other reviews which said that the Hotel was noisy - we didn't have any noise although it wouldn't have mattered, you expect some noise being in the city centre! The staff were very friendly and helpful with what to do/ where to go etc First room we had smelt a bit of dirty drains but we were quickly moved to another without any fuss. The room was very clean and comfortable and a great shower will definitely recommend and hope to return soon. Great value for what we paid

Reviews.Title: “Great location and city, lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: loz626
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Hotel Principal from the 5th to the 8th January, we really enjoyed our stay particularly because the Reis Mags festival was on the 5th and 6th. Overall we found the hotel to be lovely and it was in a superb location just off the Rambla, although some sights are quite a way away such as the Sagrada Familia and the Nou Camp, however we like walking and so this wasn't a problem, the metro also runs to these sights. At first, i must admit, we were a little concerned about the hotels situation as it was accessed by a small side street, we soon found, however, that the street was quite well lit and was very busy at all times even at night and so we didn't feel as threatened. Also it is a very short walk from the Rambla. On first impressions our room was a little small although we had booked a standard double and not an upgrade. The room was perfect for what we wanted, though, as we were simply using it as a base. The hotel has a clever light on the outside of the door which is switched on when you insert your key card into the electric slot within your room, this was really good as the maid knew when you were still in your room. The rooms and the whole hotel were absolutely spotless, the maid actually mopped the floors everyday and the towels were changed if left on the floor. We did have a small leak in our shower, but it was very small and we just mopped it up with a towel after we had finished. Also i would say that the shower was only warm and not hot, but this is very picky and it depends on personal preference. There was a kettle and safe within the room although there was a charge for the safe of €2.50 a day which wasn't too bad. We had the breakfast in the hotel everyday, it was very nice although a expensive at €9 each, there is a little cafe at the end of the street which looked nice although we did not try it. The breakfast was a buffet and so you could go up and get whatever you wanted. Breakfast consisted of hot food including: Scrambled eggs- which were very good Bacon Sausage- often 2 types, 1 spicy and the other like a hot dog Beans Fried eggs/omelette- this varied Bread for toasting- both brown and white Cold food: Meats Cheese Salad- tomatoes, lettuce, cucumber, etc Cereals Drinks: Tea Coffee Milk Fruit Juices- orange was very nice There was also croissants and a selection of jams or honey. Last year we went to Paris and i would say that Barcelona is definitely better and i felt far safer, however, it is very expensive, especially with the current £ to € rate. Lastly just a few tips, the Sagrada Familia and Nou Camp are a must, for the Nou Camp make sure you check the opening times on the website and get there early if you want to go on the tour, it is very popular. We also spent a lovely afternoon/evening at the top of Montjuic watching the sunset over Barcelona, the views from the top by the castle are amazing. I would recommend walking up Montjuic, however, it is a steep pull and there is a cable car which also has amazing views but is very high and quite expensive as it is double the price for a return!! We tried the aquarium also as it rained one day, this was a lot of fun, although again expensive at €17 each. Port Vell at the bottom of the Rambla is lovely especially on a sunny day, from here you can watch the cable cars on Montjuic. Just one more tip, there is a lovely little Italian called the Ideal Restaurant, it is on the Rambla on the corner of Carrer Nou de la Rambla. The Sangria is lovely and i must recommend the tortellini cream and ham which was so good i had it twice in our 3 day stay, my boyfriend also recommends the pizza, the food arrived very quickle and was piping hot. Don't be put off by there being nobody else in (if this happens to be the case), someone has to be first, and others will follow. Sorry for the long review but i hope if you have got this far that you found it useful.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value”
Reviews.Author: niknak1970
Reviews.Content: What a great find! Location was brilliant - just off La Ramblas, and within walking distance of pretty much everything. Breakfast was included in the deal I booked, and was spot on. I hadnt expected much - but the buffet was suitably extensive. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated. Tour bus was a good option - not far from the hotel, hop on and off all day at the main tourist spots such as Sagrada Familia and the Gaudi house and park. Travelled with friends who have been to Barcelona before, and they were equally as impressed with this hotel - wouldnt surprise me if they use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good short stay hotel, very close to La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Avenel
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel, good sized room and very helpful and friendly staff. Short 2 minute walk from La Rambla, very slightly spooky when returning to the hotel in the dark, but no problems experienced. Good buffet breakfast (E8.40) although cheaper options available nearby. Room clean and tidy with window overlooking the street. Not noisey although room on 4th floor and visited during December. Hairdryer and kettle in the room. Free internet available. We would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: annabanannaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Booked a standard double room and was pleasantly surprised at the size! Room contained 2 double beds, flat-screen TV, tea and coffee making facilities, safe (need to pay for it) and also free wi-fi connection if you bring your own laptop. There are also 4 computers in the lobby that you can use. Bathroom is big, with shower over bathtub and hairdryer. Very clean. Room is quiet, and beds are comfortable. Definitely good value. 5 minutes walk to the Ramblas. Heaps of restaurants and bars around too.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: ComingFromCanada
Reviews.Content: We would recommend the Principal. The room was very spacious, with a great big bed and large couch. Large bathroom with a great shower. Very helpful front desk staff. Well situated - close to La Rambla. One thing about the location though was that coming home late at night the neighborhood seemed a little bit questionable. It was completely fine for us and we had no trouble at all. I would hesitate to recommend it to women travelling alone though.

Reviews.Title: “better than star rating”
Reviews.Author: kingaknaa
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights on 12th Nov, absolutely spot on! From the polite reception staff to the room itself. We were allocated a balcony room (109) even though we only booked a normal room. No noise from the street below and we were on the first floor. Room itself was perfectly adequate for our needs, although we didnt spend much time there!!! Only thing that let the room down was the tepid water in the power shower, no matter what we tried we could'nt get it hot, that was a minor niggle though! 2 day safe hire was E5.75. Location was fine, 5 mins stroll from Ramblas, a little way into El Raval but at no time did we feel intimidated or uncomfortable. We are already planning another visit next year and will be using the same hotel. We were very vigilant looking out for any pickpockets etc...but can honestly say we saw absolutely nothing, I had a small money pouch that I carried under my arm so felt quite at ease. Food was fantastic, we ate at Quinze Nits one night and The Attic on Ramblas another. Both times fantastic, Quinze Nits was cheap as chips too but get there early, large queues later. Done the touristic bus, well worth it, Sagrada Familia can only be seen, no words can describe how unbelievable it is. Montjuic cable car was good, although we thought it went from where the bus drops you up to the castle then down to the marina, there are actually 2 cable car systems, the one down to the Marina is located a bit lower down from the one to the castle! The only time we nearly fell into a tourist trap was when we had been recommended Nuria retaurant at the top of Ramblas, we went to the door, a lady in a long black coat was a doorperson, we had looked at the menu outside and proceeded to enter Nuria as the prices were very reasonable, as we approached, the lady said we could go in a side entrance???? It was actually a glass door 2 feet to the left! So up the stairs we went and into the restaurant, shown to a table, there was only about 8 people in and checked the menu. To our shock the prices were double to the menu outside advertised. Me and my girlfriend decided to walk out, we got back outside the restaurant and the doorlady asked if we wanted to eat downstairs, she got told what to do!!! When looking back at the restaurant facade you could see the restaurant we were taken to was actually called Barco (sp) She had obviously been told to try and get peple into the more expensive restaurant first! So beware. But that was the only downer on an otherwise fantastic place and that was minor. English style bars were few and far between, Irish pub prices...you're looking at around 11 euros for 2 pints!!! After that we drank in the Hard Rock on Placa Catalunya, 7 euros for 2 pints. Nice one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Watson75
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via CentralR.com. Its a lovely hotel in a really central setting. It is situated just behind the Liceu Theatre, almost next to the Boqeria market, which is a must see. It is about 5 minutes walk to the centre of Las Ramblas where you will immediately notice Joan Miro's mosaic on the ground. There is a metro station there which will take you direct to the Sagrada Familia. Otherwise, everything is within walking distance. We were very happy there. The staff were very helpful. If you don't want to eat breakfast there, there are many places nearby where you can get lovely filled rolls and coffee and fresh orange juice very cheap. There are loads of shops very near to the hotel. Its a quiet area, we felt safe there. The hotel was very quiet except for the odd person coming home late and slamming doors at night. We would stay here again and can recommend it to anyone. Its location is so central, almost on the Ramblas, but much quieter. Our room and bathroom were very clean and modern. You have to pay 2.50 euro per day to use the safe in the room which should be free!

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect - look no further”
Reviews.Author: DCN
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 6 days at the Hotel Principal, in the El Raval area of Barcelona. Despite the colourful district we did not feel uncomfortable at any time tho' we did take a while to get over the semi-hysterical warnings about pick pockets at every turn. We had our car broken into in Paris as early as 1979 & know that if you experience or witness something it IS shocking but we feel this danger was overhyped to the point of potentially scaring people off Barcelona. Anyway it is also possibly that 2 women might have felt less secure in this district than a 'couple'. I sleep badly and so sent a list of attributes that I would appreciate our room having - I was not encouraged to be over-optimistic BUT the hotel came up trumps in all regards so that we had a very quiet room to the back away from the early chambermaid area & lift, without any scope for inconsiderate late returners disturbing us, being at the end of a corridor. We did indeed 'lie in' & MUCH appreciated the teabag left each day [one pack of digestives we'd brought with us & the tea - you'll need some UHT - was enough to get us moving before we explored the endless local possibilities for a coffee and croissant or pastry]. The nearby Boqueria Market can't be talked up too much - whether in search of delightful photos or food to take away, fruit or edible gifts, it was a daily must. La Rambla may have its tacky sides but it was an entertaining ramble (ha!) home via the endless moving statues, despite the appallingly caged birds (the only time I was 'threatened' was by such a stall owner when I took 2 photos) and the many shops of all price ranges. I think we ate twice there - too tired to ramble further & neither was a disater or a rip off, tho' we did walk out of one place which was going that way before ordering; you just need to choose carefully. We ate thrice in the Gothic Quarter, thanks to previous reviewers, and once round the corner from our hotel in the Square St Augusti (decor past its best but reasonably priced, opposite the cocktail bar & Orgasmic. We had our last lunch at the latter before catching our Airport bus - it WAS delicious & I thoroughly recommend it for a change, it having good natural vegi fare as well as low key tapas) The two best meals we had were in the Gothis Qutr, in Plaza Real 10 - Tobogan, & Troubador - Ferran 46. Do try any likely looking patisseries - their coffee is usually above average & the cakes were to die for; in our case near the Fontana Metro (a charming owner) & in the pouring rain in the Gràcia district (hazel nut filled meringues). Back to the hotel - we found the desk staff cold and distant, so that we made no attempt to use their expertise tho' on the last day when had to deposit our luggage they were fine & I thought it was a shame they had this kind of metaphorical defence wall - they'd been downright cold when we'd arrived late & tired, & my padlock that I'd put on my backpack in paranoia jammed so I couldn't access my booking etc.; the same happened when I had difficulty accessing my hotmail on their free pc's - they said there were no problems; the other users then told me they all had problems too. We also felt it was a bit sad that they felt they had to charge daily for safe usage in our room though I know it's not uncommon, the guest really has no choice. We would also recommend the 2 day bus touristique, tough luck if you get dreadful weather like we did for half a day as you see nothing from the downstairs floor & don't get off much but it gets you home in one piece with an idea of where to go back. We found the commentary sporadically sparse compared to Palma, Turin, Glasgow or Edinbro'. The queues at the beginning are ridiculous but think 'out side the square' & you'll soon solve that one :) We would highly recommend the son et lumière Magic Fountain in Montjuïc [note this only happens Fri & Sat 7-9 in the low season] - that whole quarter with the olympic area at the top (& Miro) and the MNAC collection & at present the Art Nouveau Alphonse Mucha at the Caixa Forum is a must. The rest of our time was divided between the obvious La S Fam, Parc G, & La Ped [glorious all 3 of course] - note the Port is a good destination in the rain because of the covered shopping & eating area; we decided to dip our toes in the Med in Sitges [v pretty] so have no idea if we missed much at the Barca beaches. To return to the hotel - you can't go wrong location, cleanliness etc despite one or two eccentricities - remember to ASK for what you want via direct email: hotel@hotelprincipal.es & fingers crossed they'll be as obliging as they were to us when it mattered, if not face to face.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Principal - Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boyd08
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Principal with my new husband. We were visiting Barcelona for a short break to see the sights and i had previously booked a higher star rated hotel and changed last-minute as we realised it was quite far out from the centre. I booked this hotel based on the previous reviews and i am so glad i did!!! We got a taxi direct to the hotel for around 25 euros, we arrived 2 hours before check-in and although our room wasn't ready we were able to leave our luggage in a side room and asked to come back an hour later (so still earlier than we were supposed to check-in). La Rambla is less than a 5 minute walk and is really the centre of going anywhere in Barcelona. We returned and got the key to our room, where we were so pleasantly surprised, the room/bed/sheets were spotless as was the bathroom with an amazing power shower, some toiletries, clean towels (which were changed every day) and a hairdryer. We had a TV with lots of channels, altho the only English speaking channel was CNN, but who cares, you're not there for the tv!! You have free access to internet in the hotel, they have 2 or 3 PC's which you can use at anytime and vending machines, for drinks/snacks/neccessities. They have a buffet breakfast from 7.30-10.30, for about 7 euros, we never had this but it looked lovely and fresh. The hotel is totally non-smoking, I do smoke but i either went out to the front of the hotel where they had ashtrays or up to the terrace on the roof. The hotel knew we had recently married and they left us a bottle of champagne in our room on the first night with a note to say it was a present to us from the hotel, we were totally overwhelmed as we actually honeymooned in a 5star+ hotel in Mexico and didn't even get so much as a congratulations so it was lovely to have that little caring touch. At the top of the street that the hotel is on there is a little bar/cafe on corner, i think it's called Zanzibar or something similar, the sncks were lovely, and they do the most amazing mohitos. Was lovely to come back after a day of sightseeing and sit there and relax and people watch. I would definitly recommend doing the 2 day Turistic bus tours which run on red/blue/circle routes. The best way to see all of Barcelona in a nut shell - costs 20 E for 1 day or 26E for 2 days, you can buy tickets from Placa Catalyan which is a square at the top of La Rambla, you will see the buses/tour guides when you go up there. My husband and I also had the best meal of our lives at Shoko, a Japanese restaurant down at Port Olympic, we got the Blue Route bus and got off at Po Ol, you will see it from the main road if you go back on yourself, it's tucked in behind the casino. Food amazing and gorgeous setting/atmosphere. We both had starters/mains and i had dessert and a bottle of wine for around 80E but definitly worth it :) Overall, we loved it, there are lots of pickpockets around but if you're aware of them it's fine, we never had any problems although we did see 2 men being pickpocketed, but they had left their bags on the ground and open wide, think they were also locals as we tried to explain to them what had happened and they didn't understand. Just make sure you keep your bags closed/zipped and in front of you and it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than It's 2 Star Rating!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiGirl2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during August and had a great experience. The rooms were immaculate and modern - our room was air conditioned, and the bathroom was clean (with a great shower). The hotel also has free internet access, which is an added bonus. The location is brilliant - just off the Ramblas. The only downside is that it is quite noisy - we were woken early both mornings by the cleaners outside our room. This hotel is great value for money - much better than it's two star official rating would otherwise suggest and I would definately recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: V2008
Reviews.Content: We booked through the website and so got a great deal. Its close to Las Ramblas and the train station which makes it easy to get to. Would definately recomment it if you want to stay close to the action. The room was clean and the free internet was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Canadian45
Reviews.Content: good staff, two blocks from the Mercato, in a bit of a rougher part of town. I'd suggest the other side of the Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: MrNMrs_H
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Principal in Barcelona. It is a clean hotel that's situated a few minutes walk from Las Ramblas & a metro station & offers free internet access. Our room was cleaned & towels changed daily & the bed linen also got changed once during our stay. The room was not very big, had a small balcony & a decent sized bathroom but the shower cubicle was tiny (though since being home I've seen a review by someone who said there's was massive!). I'd emailed ahead to ask for a balcony room & got a reply saying I'd to enquire on arrival at the hotel & it would be 10 Euros per night extra, we never enquired & just got it at no extra cost. There is an ample sized sun terrace on top of the hotel from which you can view the neighbours sleeping in a morning outside on their mattresses (ha ha). The hot & cold buffet breakfast was 7 Euros extra, we only went once, it was handy and filled a hole. The only real downsides were the fact that the cleaners started (too) early and the bottle bins were emptied even earlier, so if you're thinking of having a late night & a lie in, forget it! All in all, we paid £200 for 3 nights at a city hotel that was clean & centrally located, apart from the lack of lie in I guess we can't really grumble at that!

Reviews.Title: “Great value but one small prob”
Reviews.Author: katinahat
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for a long weekend in August. The rooms were very clean, spacious and cool (great air con). In fact, well above the 2 star quality we were expecting. We had two rooms, one twin (with two 3/4 double beds) and one single (same size bed). The only problem was the very noisy corridors. So in both rooms we were woken up by people coming in at 2-3am (well it is Barcelona) and again at 8am by the cleaners chatting outside our doors. We soon discovered that both rooms were next to the cleaners' cupboard - so would recommend that you ask for a room away from these! Otherwise a great stay, really handy location (slightly grimy but we never felt unsafe at all) and well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Please...don't be put off by location!”
Reviews.Author: swalker123
Reviews.Content: I have just been to BCN for 5 days, from 21st to 26th Aug 2008. When i was researching hotels back in May I used trip advisor and looked at web sites showing the local area. Now, the hotel is in Raval, known as the 'red light' district of Barca. I was hesitant to book the hotel but in the end I am sooo glad i did. Sorry this review is so long but i wanted it to be honest and thorough) THE AREA: Excellent for getting around the city. it is right in the heart of the city. The hotel is on the doorstep of LIceu metro station which will take you around town. Outside on la Rambla is a very easy to use bus system, the number 59 takes you direct to the beach. Very close to bars, resturants, cafes etc...all very handy when you find you are eating out most nights and walking home after a heavy meal. Although the hotel is pretty much on las ramblas it is very easy to take a stroll (5 mins walk) to other areas, such as Placa Reial to eat and there are excellent little boutique shops on C/ de Ferran (spelling?). When you come out of Liceu station the first thing you will notice is the smell. BCN does smell, especially in the older parts like Barrio Gotic, Cuitat Veilla, Raval, the beach etc. I don't know why this is (drains, Iave been told) but you get used to it and it isn't all that bad. It's worth staying in these areas because you would miss out on so many cultural experiences otherwise. Secondly you notice the prostitutes. Yes, you heard right, but they are not blatant about what they are doing and definitely not 'slutty' or anything. In fact, most of them are so discreet until someone told me what to look for I missed them. They look like they are just hanging around with their friends, so don't worry about it being a problem if you have children and are staying in that area, it really isn't offensive. HOTEL: Fantastic! We stayed in room 326, a superior room, which we booked with breakfast. This was back in may sometime and cost around £535. the room was very clean, nicely decorated and spacious, defeinitely big enough for two adults. I would say that perhaps it would not be big enough for a family with young children, particularly more than one child because the furniture is quite large. The room had an IKEA style sofa bed (good for children to sleep on) and a chair. Rooms also had tea making facilities, and cleaners change the cups daily. The cleaners did come rather early, (around 7-8am) but that's typical of all hotels really. The wardrobe is a double, but a small one, but there is plenty of drawer space and a shoe rack. My only qualm is the bathroom. The door is large and when fully open gets in the way of the toilet and so is quite tricky to access. That's all really. the bathroom is very clean, and newly decorated with marble worktops and clean white suits. The staff were very helpful as well, especially as we didn't check until 1am. I no I probably sound like an advert but i was very impressed with the hotel given that it is only a two star. If anyone wants to email me with questions i will be happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean and Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bec82
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a long weekend in August. It was really easy to get to from the airport and in a great central location for all Barcelona activities. The side street the hotel is located on is not as dismal as other reviewers state - it's quite clean actually. The hotel itself is very clean and friendly. The staff were really nice and helpful. Our room was on the small side, but it was very clean, the bathroom was great and we had a cute little balcony. All in all this was a great find for the price. We didn't have breakfast included, but there were plenty of nice bakeries around to grab something on our way out.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Kiwigal000
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for two adults and our 12 year old daughter. We were in room 421 which was "very" spacious and looked over the street. It looked like a bigger and nicer room than many of the others I saw open. After a month of staying in 3 star hotels in Europe, we found this one the most luxurious and best value. Definitly more like a 4 star.There was a tv, tea & coffee facilities, lovely big bathroom with some toiletries provided. The beds were comfortable. Everything looked very new and clean, with very pleasant decor. The reception staff spoke English and were very helpful. The full buffet breakfast was very nice, as was the dining room. There were also laptops and internet to use free of charge. The hotel was very central - just off the middle of the famous La Ramblas street that everyone visits, and close to lots of shops and restaurants. I had been a bit concerned before we went that some people thought the area was seedy, but it did not seem any different to other back streets in central Barcelona. We were happy with it as it was great to be so central. It was also very easy and cheap to get there from the airport - we caught the airport bus from just outside the airport (4 euros each) to the last stop in town, then walked for 10 minutes down La Ramblas to the hotel street. I would also recommend the "Bus turistic" open top double decker, hop on hop off, bus for seeing the whole city easily and at your own pace. It is also very easy to catch a train for half an hour to the seaside resort of "Sitges". We had a lovely stay at Hotel Principal and loved the beautiful city of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “hotel situated next to rambla”
Reviews.Author: Leon-Inic
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 9 day vacation in Barcelona - we were a family of six.. The weather is fantastic, nice but not too hot. The hotel though situated in a run down street is very nice and clean from the inside. The bathroom and beds were always very clean, and towels changed daily. We were not impressed by the breakfast and opted to have a light snack outside hotel. The open air market so close to hotel is very convenient, especially if you like fruit. The hotel is practically on the Rambla and the metro station is very close. Hotel staff are very helpful and can speak some English. The free internet service is also very convenient. Beware of pick pocketing - we were robbed twice! Pay extra attention if you decide to take the Barcelona sight seeing bus as this is an excellent target for pickpockets. Overall we had a good time in Barcelona and enjoyed our stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good base for barcelona”
Reviews.Author: antoniamrgn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the 4th july to 7th of july.Firstly i emalied requesting a quiet room,which i did receive and with a balcony, i didnt find no promblems with noise ect,Rooms were spotless and basic which is just what we were after.Bathrooms really modern no bath but shower was fine and i didnt encounter any promblems with water temperature,I am really funny when it comes to booking and staying in hotels and i am a trip advisor addict and i can honestly say this is a good base 4 barcelona we were never in are room so to wash sleep it was a excellent choice.plus free internet is really handy. There are also 3 vending machines in hotel for crisp chocolate,water,ect really handy 4 late at night. Hotel is situated just off the ramblas 5mins walk there are 2 supermarkets to the left of teh hotel which are great for alcohol,food toiletries bread,ice cream. There is a street bar at the end on the right which has great sandwiches,drinks for half the price compared to on the ramblas. I was charged more than i had thought as they add a 7% tax which i thought was included so a little tip just ring up and confirm price and ask if this is including tax,this was my only promblem i encountered. I didnt have breakfast as we were out and about so couldnt comment on this overall good clean friendly hotel. TIPS walk down side streets and you will get drinks food for half the price on the ramblas. walk down to port big shopping outlet great views great restraunts and good prices. I didnt witness no crime but i was very careful always held bag in front of me always walked with crowds when walked off the ramblas,plus my boyfriend had a body bag under pants with passports money in.I feel if you are careful wary and not blatent with money belongings you will be fine. Definitly take the bus touristic really good 20 euros for 1 day 26 euros for 2.It takes you to bercelonas ground,gaudis catherdral and lots of other attractions there are 2 buses do both ,tickets is for all day. on the whole barcelona was a lovely break really expensive but if u just budget and search for little pubs restraunts of the ramblas you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Central location modernised rooms”
Reviews.Author: dibbledog
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel recently for my husband's 40th. Hotel has recently been modernised. We were pleasantly surprised. Clean rooms, modern bathroom. We found room to be quiet at night. Did not have the breakfast so could not comment. The location was ideal although we tended to eat and drink on the other side of La Ramblas in the gothic quarter, where there are some lovely little restaurants and bars, which was much nicer. We did a Fat Tire Bike Tour which we would highly recommend to see some of the sights and have a bit of a laugh and the guys who run the tour are very knowledgeable on the history of the city and we learnt a lot - even give you time for a stop on the beach for lunch and some sangria!

Reviews.Title: “Warmly recommended”
Reviews.Author: AnneandCliff
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by surroundings. Although this hotel is surrounded by rather shabby streets, inside it is modern, comfortable and well equipped. Staff are friendly and helpful and buffet breakfast is excellent. Although close to Las Ramblas, we had a very quiet room looking over a courtyard. A kettle, cups and teabags are provided but take your own powdered milk if you drink your tea without sugar! We would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: stephentwist
Reviews.Content: If you are spending a few days in Barcelona and want to be in the centre of things, this hotel is for you. Clean, well run, secure, modernised bedrooms with first class ensuite shower room. Internet access in the foyer is also excellent. Our deal did not include breakfast, so we ate at the coffee shop the next street down in C/Carme or at Vitaminas C/Hospital 81: ask for the bacadillo with avocado and cheese to take out! Just along the road is Bibiloteca (Junta de Comerce 28): the most divine restaurant, and across the road is Organica: worth a visit if you like really fresh organic food. The other great benefit of this hotel is the proximity of the covered market. The only down-side is noise. As with most hotels in Barcelona, at night you have to take street noise in your stride.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: RichDar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights after a wonderful Transatlantic from Galveston to Barcelona on RCI Voyager of the Seas. The hotel is clean and about a block to the Ramblas. It looked like the bathroom was recently updated. Breakfast was included and offered a variety including scrambled eggs, bacon, fruit, and pastry. The staff was friendly and helpful with tourist info. We would come back to the Principal. Hotel is in an area that looks intimidating, my wife and I had no problems getting around. Kept our money, passports and cards in neck pouch. We did the Hop on Tourist Bus for 2 days enjoyed Gaudi. Took the Metro, Train and Cable car on a day trip to Montserrat Monastery about 65 miles away-highly recommend going. Get an earlier start than us, we started at 10:30 am, would have liked more time there. I had been to Barcelona in 1970 and 80 when in the Navy. Lot more tourists there now from Europe and like everything more expensive. Find places away from Ramblas to eat, more authentic, better quality and less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location, fair price.”
Reviews.Author: MisterTom
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 days at this hotel based on recommendations on Trip Advisor. I agree with all the other reviews. It was clean, neat, recently modernized, etc. The water was off one morning for an hour, so no shower until after breakfast, but otherwise no issues with the room. Breakfast was more than sufficient. Location was excellent, 2 blocks off the middle of Las Ramblas, on the edge a of a somewhat seedy neighborhood, but that was not a problem. Front desk was very helpful, open 24 hours and spoke English. One day the three computers didn't work but i was invited into the office to use a computer there. Other guests ran the gambit of international travelers of all ages and nationalities. Avoid the restaurants on Las Ramblas as they cater to the tourist crowd, we generally walked around north and east of Plaza de Catalunyas and discovered great restaurants. The front desk warned us of pickpockets, and there were right. A technique is to ask you for the time or to get right into your face so that you have to raise your hands to look at your watch or fend off someone, hence leaving your wallet approachable. Take heed, have fun. Pickpockets are a problem in any major tourist city, and I was glad to have been forewarned by the hotel staff. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: IrishLouise
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in April, and being a girl travelling alone, I wanted to make sure that I was centrally located, in a decent hotel, without having to pay obove the odds for a single occupancy as is sometimes the case (Manchester United were playing Barcelona so I was suspicious that us travelling Reds would get ripped off, but that certainly wasn't the case in the Hotel Principal). The hotel is a 2 min walk from the top end of the Ramblas, so location was perfect! It was only €165 for single occupancy of a double room for 2 nights, which I thought was very reasonable for the location and standard of hotel - the room was spacious enough and very clean! There was complimentary internet access, the staff were very polite & helpful, and I honestly can't fault the place at all, given what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “A more perfect location couldn't be found!!”
Reviews.Author: Jensjeremies
Reviews.Content: My partner and I are just back from 3 nights in Hotel Principal, Barcelona. I booked the hotel after reading reviews from this site. When we arrived in Barcelona we got the Airport bus into Plaza de Catalunya. The bus was cheap and very quick. We didn't really know where the hotel was although they had provided directions with the booking. But with luggage etc we decided to get a taxi. Plaza de Catalunya is right at the top of Las Ramblas which we could look down. We were smiling when the taxi turned into Las Ramblas because that meant our hotel was central. The hotel is off hospital street, I think it's the 1st or 2nd street off it. Literally 2-3 minutes walk from Las Rambles. The benefit of being a street away is that we couldn't hear any noise from the main tourist area (if there was any). The hotel was very clean and quite modern. The room we had was large with a double bed and a single bed. modern bathroom with powerful shower (always V important!), plenty of storage space and a safety deposit box. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is even FREE internet access!! Great if you want to check your flight is on time. We were able to leave our luggage with the hotel as we had an evening flight. Breakfast wasn't included in the booking but we paid for it one day - It was good by City Break standards, hot and cold buffet for about €8. The rooms also had air conditioning for those hot summer days and nights. The hotel is very close the metro stop Liceu (On Las Ramblas 2-3 mins)(green Line). The food market is about two streets up. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Principal and would recommend it to anyone. Barcelona in general is quite expensive for hotels but this was reasonable and the location and facilities were perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: popsider
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in a great location - just off La Rambla. It's obviously been refurbished recently and was very clean, smart and modern. It was really useful having the use of the free internet terminals downstairs - good for checking on the weather and for confirming our flights home. If you're a light sleeper I'd recommend trying to avoid getting a room on the main street as it's a bit noisy. Having said that, we asked if it was possible to be moved and the reception staff helped us out very quickly and got us a room at the back, which was a lot quieter. Our room was quite small but you don't go on holiday to stay in your room all day do you?

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: amycran
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel over Easter in 2008. We are both in our mid 20s and booked the hotel through a travel agent. We were really pleased with the hotel. Location: Very well located, off a side street, close to La Rambla. I would recommend organising a pre-arranged airport transfer however, as our taxi-driver from the airport dropped us some distance from the hotel and we had to walk around to find it. Hotel: Generally well run, clean and organised with a 24 hour check in desk. The service level is good overall. The receptionists all speak English and are friendly. They don't go out of their way to give advice on restaurants etc, but there are maps and brochures available. Breakfasts: Nice hot and cold breakfasts available at the ground floor restaurant. The restaurant itself is basic but it is clean with a good selection of buffet-style food (eggs, bacon, toast, cereals, pastries, fruit). Rooms: Our room was a standard double room on the 3rd floor with 2 single beds and a bathroom. The room was pleasant and modern, and had some atmosphere too which was nice. There was a good sized wardrobe, a safe, and also a set of drawers. We had a TV but no fridge/minibar. However, there are a lot of small corner-stores nearby so we bought some water and snacks for the room easily. The bathroom had a bath and shower, with one towel each. The rooms have daily house-keeping service and are very clean. Our room opened onto a small communal patio which was nice. There is also air-con. We found the noise level from the hotel corridor to be a little bit invasive, but nothing too bad. Overall: We thought this hotel was very good value for money. I went on to recommend the hotel to a close friend who is going to Barcelona with her brother.

Reviews.Title: “your principal hotel for a great stay”
Reviews.Author: fiftyBentley
Reviews.Content: Because I booked a last minute with a low cost airline company al the cheaper deals for a hotel were gone. However via hotel.club.net we managed to book a double at the Hotel Principal for 204 euro's including breakfast and I have been pleasantly surprised about the quality of the hotel. For 204 euro's I have been in worse hotels. Some hotel in Paris, the name eludes me,charged 350 for a two days stay. The location of the Hotel is great. Situated just of the Rambla in a nice and quiet street within walking distance of the plaza Catalunya, Gothic Neighborhood and of course la Rambla. The staff were really friendly and had great suggestions about things to do and to see and because we caught a really early flight we were at the check in at the hotel at 9 o clock and they already let us check in, which was great so we could take a shower and do a quick nap. I am not that fussy about the type of room I stay in size wise but it has to be clean and especially the bathroom. The hotelroom was not that big, but it was nice and clean with , laminated floors? I am not that big a fan of carpet on the floors as rooms with carpet do tend to get a bit musty. The bathroom was really spacious and though it did not have bath, had wonderful shower and it was nice and clean. ( People who have lived in student houses probably can appreciate a nice a shower) The only minus point which I can think of is the fact that on the first day we did not have enough towels only two small ones.But he I guess we could have asked for some more. In summary I would definately recommend this hotel for everybody

Reviews.Title: “Very good.”
Reviews.Author: EnergyBelfast
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern, lovely breakfasts. Fantastic location. Had a great time staying there - only gripe was the cleaners making so much noise every morning along the hallway. But other than that - a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve049
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay, excellent choice, everything spot on . location good hotel spotless breakfast great, rooms little small but never in em only to sleep. Dont eat on the ramblas to expensive, find the cava bar by the port side street, cava flowing bottle for 2 only 3 euros and a all you can eat buffet on the street ajoining ramblas by the gaudi bit further down. In general spent a fortune its not cheap barcelona but you have to spend when there cause theres loads to do, see ya next year,

Reviews.Title: “Above our expecations..”
Reviews.Author: jieisto
Reviews.Content: We decided to choose this hotel after we had read so many good comments about it from the Internet. We stayed there for three nights. Hotel Principal is above our expectation. Our sleeping room is very clean and bright. The bath room is big. The shower cabin inside the bath room is cool, but the glass door of the shower cabin is a little bit broken...WIFi internet at the room works very well. The hotel is only 5 minuters away from Liceu Metro station. Do not recommend taking the taxi that called by the hotel staff!! The hotel staff told us its very cheap to take the taxi to the north station. But the taxi driver actually charged us 14EUR for driving us there. 8EUR+2EUR (2xbaggage fee)+4EUR(additional fee to the north station) We were going to catch the early flight shuttle bus to the Girona airport at 8:00 this morning. According to the taxi driver that it is not possible to buy the ticket on the bus during weekend, and all the ticket offices open at 9:00 only. He 'kindly' offered his help for driving us to the airport instead so that we would not miss our flight. We felt its suspicious about what he said and turned down his suggestion. Later on, it was not difficult for us to find the ticket office which was already open in the north station. Imagine if we believed what the taxi driver said..we would spend at least 120EUR on this trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: sdorling
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on easytobook.com and checked out the reviews on tripadvisor. Perfect location, just off las Ramblas. Room was lovely and clean, spacious (especially for a city hotel) with air conditioning and a power shower! Only criticism would be the noise overnight from rubbish / glass collections every night. If you're a light sleeper I would recommend trying to book an interior room. If not then enjoy the balcony, not brilliant view but then we didn't spend much time in the hotel with this beautiful city to visit on our doorstep!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent price/quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: Truska
Reviews.Content: It is a simple hotel but it is very well located, near the Liceu metro station. My room was clean and since I was on business there, the detail of having a kettle and a cup of tea so I could make my own everyday was something I did appreciate. It was also very usefull the downstairs room where you can sit at the computer with free internet as long as you like... Now this is being over the edge: they could change their drinks expending machines from pepsi to coke...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: HoboProf
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, reasonably priced hotel in a great location. it's just off La Ramblas and a short walk to the Metro and/or the official tourist buses of Barcelona. The staff was friendly and helpful. Free computers and internet access available. The room was a bit on the small size, and the television was horrible, but then again you're in Barcelona and probably shouldn't be sitting in the room all day anyway. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: chris1107
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Principal for the last week of November 2007. I had an excellent experience in this hotel. In fact it probably should be a 3 star rating instead of 2. I had a single room which was very comfortable and clean. This may be the first time I stayed in a hotel and did not experience ambient noise coming from adjacent rooms. The only issue for me was people arriving late at night and not having any consideration while in the hallways. But that’s another story. The hotel is a short walk to La Rambla and almost every sight in the old city and L’Exiample is accessible from the metro . The breakfast -at 8 euros extra per day- is a western style buffet (eggs, toast, coffee etc...). Liceu metro stop is a short walk away on La Rambla and the marina can be reached on foot in less than 10 minutes. Warning: WATCH YOUR WALLET. Barcelona is rampant with pick pocketing thieves. Sadly, I was a victim of this while riding the metro (the last day of my trip). When I went to the police office to report the theft, there was a line of people who also shared similar stories with me. I also witnessed a theft while sitting inside a bus. You’ve been warned! The hotel also has a nice rooftop terrace with ample seating. The outdoor bar/café at the end of the street is a nice convenience for the weary tourist at the end of the day. However I would avoid the restaurant across the street from the bar. There are many better options a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SED77
Reviews.Content: Considering the hotel is only a 2 star, we were pleasantly pleased with the place. It was literally just a few moments walk from Las Ramblas and the Gothic area. The only down side to this hotel, which can easily be rectified with a travel kettle, is there was no coffee/tea maker etc... I quite like to be able to have a coffee in the morning before going for breakfast! We weren't booked in for breakfast, but there were plenty of places around the hotel. I would suggest hanging around the Gothic area mostly for bars/restaurants and cafes, as Las Ramblas is very expensive and I wasn’t too impressed, mainly by the rude service. I have been going to Spain since I was a child, some 30 years and actually lived there for 5, so if you speak Spanish from Valencia, don’t bother here as you may end up having an ashtray thrown down on your table as I did, amongst other things! Hey ho, I still really enjoyed the city and the hotel is a great base to start. The Metro is also only a few minutes walk away and I would definatley recommend the hop-on, hop-off travel bus. Very easy to use and cheap too!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tom057
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in very good location, close to Ramblas and the Port, shops and transport. Room was very clean, air con was excellent. Self service breakfast was very good, and staff we found to be friendly and helpful. Room was cleaned every morning by friendly staff. Shower and bathroom very good. Would recommend and would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: travelicious84
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel stayed there for two nights occupying a triple room. I can't say anything bad about this hotel at all. Service was excellent we did not have enough towels the day we arrived and we received them in about 5 mins. Breakfast buffet was included in the deal, again excellent value for money and lots of choice. I was a bit worried about some of the reviews saying that the breakfast was not all that and the so called shady area. I'm not sure what people definition of shady is but i did not find this area shady at all and i was a part of group of three girls and we had absolutly no problems during the day and early hours of the morning. In regards to the breakfast if you want convenience then it is def worth it and like i mentioned good quality (well i happily stuffed my face). Location was also very good relativly easy to find altho you may need to ask for directions but people are more then friendly in helping and there is a station nearby to the hotel like 5 mins away. Only thing i have to say to be wary of which is nothing to do with the hotel. Is pickpockets who are rife in Barcelona and i had two not so good experiences with them. There are however safe's available in the rooms which i did not use and looking back probably should of. All in all tho very good experience with this hotel and if i was to go back i would book with this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caprice611
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here from October 20-24th. We're in our late 20's and wanted to do a lot of sightseeing and stay at a decent, relatively inexpensive, very conveniently located hotel. This hotel was perfect. We booked at otel dot com and it worked out to about $160 USD/night including buffet breakfast. Room and Check-In: We arrived at the hotel at 10 am after our cruise and were very surprised that our room was ready. We stayed in room 331 (3rd floor) and it was compact and had a view of a wall (ok since we were hardly there). The important items in the room were a hair dryer, safe, no alarm clock (but wake up calls were fine), flat screen tv, kettle, shampoo (not very good quality so bring your own). Location: Excellent! This was the reason we stayed here. If you're coming from the airport (buy a T10 - 10 trips for $6.90 euros or $1.25 euros per single ticket), take the Renfe train to Placa de Catalunya (20 minutes) and you can either walk down La Rambla (10 minutes) or transfer to the metro and go to Liceu station (2-3 minute walk). Either option, you want to turn right on Carrer de Hospital and turn left 2 blocks down on Junta Del Comerc. Once you turn the corner, you'll see the hotel. You're about 2 blocks (3 minute walk) from the closest metro stop and the subway is very easy to use. You can also walk to most places including Mercat de la Boqueria (<5 minutes), Catedral de Barcelona (10 minutes) , Museu Picasso (15 minutes), Placa de Catalunya (10 minutes) where most of the good shopping starts as you head further up. Amenities/Service: Not very many as this is a 2 star hotel and service was ok (although dining room employees were very nice). Free internet on the main floor (3 terminals) was excellent. The service/hospitality from the front desk employees is seriously lacking. On a few occassions, the front desk employees didn't speak English well at all and if they could, they didn't have answers to my questions. Buffet breakfast: Very good selection and fills you up for a good day of sight seeing. Selections included scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, croissants, toast, selection of hams and cheeses, yogurt, cereal, milk, coffee, and teas. Restaurant recommendations: -Comerc 24 (take the subway to Arc de Triomf) - had the tasting menu for about $60 euros/person (wine extra). Very creative and tasty dishes. -Cal Pep (near Museu Picasso/walking distance) - very tasty tapas including calamari and sausages for around $10 euros each tapa -Can Majo (take the subway to Barceloneta or walk >30 minutes) - best seafood paella at $14 euros/person -El Cellar de Can Roca (in Girona, 1 hour by train) - 11th best restaurant in the world this year. Tasting menu was around $80 euros and was truly a memorable and delicious experience. Girona is also a very lovely city to explore. -do not eat on La Rambla as it is overpriced and the food quality is ok -Pans is a fast food type sandwich place (all over and one on La Rambla) - good choice if you're in a hurry or want something relatively cheap ($4 euros for a footlong ham and brie sandwich) Shopping Recommendations: -Zara, H&M, Mango, Sfera are all on Passeig de Gracia -soccer jerseys can be found in many stores along La Rambla and all over as well as Nike and FCB (the official Barca store). There's one at the airport too for your last chance to buy one. Other notes: -we stayed at Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya for one night before our cruise (4 star, much better hotel, but away from the touristy sights). Booked at HotelsRUs dot com for $176 USD/night including an excellent buffet breakfast -take a taxi to the cruise terminal (we walked 2 miles from the bottom of La Rambla) I'm happy to answer any questions at caprice611 at hotmail dot com.

Reviews.Title: “Not a happy hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: appliepie2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the centre of Las Ramblas and only 2 minutes from the everything.However, please be warned that the hotel is behind a red light district so ladies please be careful when walking home late at night! As the hotel is situated down a run down ally it can be daunting walking late at night. The rooms are very basic but very clean, however we found the staff to be rude and could do with some customer service training. The service was very infantile and dated and we found the most basic of things we requested were denied. Do not expect room service or any luxuries - however the restaurant staff were extremely helpful and happy to help. There is also a roof terrace which we found out about on our last hour at the hotel which we could have enjoyed more if the 'helpful staff'' had informed their paying guests - the views from it are dreadful but worth it if you are looking at topping up your tan!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thank goodness for Hotel Principal!”
Reviews.Author: Tabb
Reviews.Content: After booking a room across the street at La Terrassa and finding that place to be quite uninhabitable, we popped into Hotel Principal to see if rooms were available. The first night we had an inside room for 70 euros, same price as the horrible, dirty, cramped La Terrassa, and although the Hotel Principal room was very small, it was perfectly clean and much more nicely furnished than La Terrassa. The next 3 nights we moved to an exterior room with balcony for 90 euros, much better size and very sunny and clean and nice. Great location, polite staff. Area didn't feel "shady" at all, it is so close to Las Ramblas and there are tons of people around, even when we came home at 4am. Of course, keep your wits about you, as you would in any big city. Walking distance to lots of good stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dash_R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend in early September 2007. We were 2 couples and each of us got excellent rooms. Our room had no balcony but had a fantastic shower/bathroom (room 326) . Our friends had a balcony over looking the road and 2 double beds (room 321). The rooms were clean and very comfortable, and the air con was ice cold which was excellent given the temperatures we had, it has a lift also. The hotel has a few vending machines selling over priced water and snacks, but there are load of shops around, even a small supermarket about 6 houses down the road. The hotel has Wi-fi also, and free internet access via 3 pcs in the lobby. The hotel itself is about 2 mins walk to the middle of the Ramblas (home of the over priced beer and food), but if you head the other way you can eat great food at the fraction of the cost. I have read about the "dodgey" street on other reviews, but its no problem, we never felt threatened, always people about. The hotel has a 2* rating but I would think its more like a 3*. The only negative comment would be that it has no bar (but plenty around the hotel) and provides cups/kettle, but no tea bags/coffee milk etc, but its a moot point really. I reccommend this place for all.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT GREAT GREAT”
Reviews.Author: robbo1963
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in early september. We had a double room overlooking the street - very clean great little view over the street with the balcony. Suprisingly very quiet... I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Great location so close to La Ramblas..... and the main square. Well done management and staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend the Principal”
Reviews.Author: MerseysidePippa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned a week ago from a great trip to Barcelona where we stayed at the Principal. The room was spacious and clean and we had a small balcony overlooking the street. Staff were very helpful on the whole. The breakfast was good, cereal, croissants, bacon sausage scrambled egg, cheese, meat, juice etc. The area isn't the nicest but we never felt unsafe and I wouldn't let that put you off at all, in fact I felt more unsafe around the back streets of the Gothic area where someone tried to pick my husband's pocket! The hotel is in a good spot, very close to La Rambla and for access to the metro, also walking distance to Placa Catalunya where you can get the Tourist bus and bus to the airport. Would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: jessandmatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from June 26th-29th. We arrived early and our room was ready for us to check in right away. The hotel room was a nice size, pleasant decor, nice wood floors and we also had a small balcony over looking the street that the hotel was on. There were two beds in our room, one double and a twin even although we did not need the second bed. The room and bathroom were always very clean and the rest of the hotel seemed to be as well.
