The staff seemed ok and were helpful when asked questions. The few times that we took a taxi they knew where the hotel was, so I guess we got lucky as I see others have had problems with that. The hotel was a very short walk to Las Ramblas, in walking distance to some of the major sites and easy access to the Placa de Catalunya where you can board the bus turistic. The beach (Barceloneta) on the other hand is a bit of a hike and we had to take a cab or the metro to Port Olympic because it was too far. All in all we were able to navigate nicely from the hotel. We are not able to comment on breakfast at the hotel b/c we chose to eat out for breakfast. There is a nice little place just down from the hotel, at the end of the street (if you take a left out of the hotel) that has a standing bar and we really liked the food and coffee, the market is near by or there are plenty of other places to sit down or grab something to eat or some great coffee. The street and area of the hotel is a bit "shady" but we did not have any problems with anyone on the streets. I would be careful in the large dept. store there, there are a lot of thiefs roaming around. We were actually followed by a really bad one for quite a while. He was so obvious (it was pathetic actually)....so he did not end up being a problem for us as we were on to him from the start. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel or stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jrcroydon
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location just off ramblas. Had twin room which was 2 double beds, although i dont think they all are. The new bathrooms are very nice. I agree the roads do look a bit creepy from ramblas to the hotel but never had any problems. The view from window is not great but i wasnt after a nice view. If you want a reasonably priced hotel with nice rooms and bathrooms, A/C and great location i think you will strugle to find better in Barceona.

Reviews.Title: “Hotee Principal ”
Reviews.Author: AJH36
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a 3 night stay at this Hotel. Found it very clean quiet and comfortable. Our room was on the 4th floor. It was rather small but adequate but the view from the small balcony was not pleasant but as we were only there for a few days it did not bother us unduly. None of the taxi drivers seemed to know where this Hotel was so we use to carry a piece of headed note paper around so show them the address. It is up a very dodgy looking road but we did not experience any problems. Some of the reception and kitchen staff were very rude although the lady on the desk on the last day was very helpful when our taxi failed to appear. Don't bother with the breakfast for the 8 euros they charge you can get a much better one on Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, good air conditioning, secure surroundings, breakfast available”
Reviews.Author: Lauriecarol1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. It is quiet, clean and most of the staff are pleasant. It is close to Las Ramblas, but the street on which it is located is a bit creepy. The walk to Las Ramblas is short, but many strange characters are there. The breakfast was adequate, but I felt it should be extended past 10:30 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Duderoo1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Principal for four nights, we where originally given a back room on the 4th floor (even though I had emailed them twice stating that this was out honeymoon and could we have a nice room and the confirmed this) I asked for a change to the front and a smoking room and they where fine with this. The hotel is a good budget hotel; we found the rooms very nice and the bathroom with nice showers cool. The view from the 1st floor wasn’t much but we enjoyed people watching or rather workmen watching, as the road outside was full of them and the noise was quite bad between 8am-6pm. The breakfast was ok, the usual Spanish meats and cheeses and some warm food was prepared and croissants and fruit (we got down early as the usual middle aged snobs turned up and caused an atmosphere). The location wasn’t bad, behind the hotel on the next street it is really rough with drunks, hookers, druggies and criminals, we made a mistake of walking down there looking for a night cap as the hotel has no bar and it wasn’t a pleasant experience, the café at the top of the road is very nice and cheap of snacks and drinks. Even though it was obviously a rough area we didn’t feel threatened at anytime but it wasn’t nice walking past drunks and druggies all day everyday. Overall it was a pleasant stay, the staff where friendly, the room was fine, the price wasn’t bad, and the food ok but the location isn’t a great asset. We would return if we decided in the future that Barcelona wasn’t over priced on everything and covered with graffiti.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cost effective”
Reviews.Author: Tiger_Totty
Reviews.Content: Hotel is down some side streets 5 minute walk away from the main street of La Rambla with its metro stop of Liceu - so you are within easy reach of the rest of the City via the metro. Location wise the hotel is great but during the night the side streets were a little daunting and saw a girl get her bag snatched – just keep your wits about you and you will have no problems. There are lots of lovely local bars and cafes near the hotel – much better value that those of on La Rambla – found lovely tapas bars and ate with the locals. Found one bar just down the street taking a right out of the hotel which was a good night and one lovely one set in the walled garden area found by walking out of the hotel taking a left and left again and there is a large wall opposite – go through the large gate and to the left is a lovely little outside bar area – kind of set in a walled garden area. Would advise taking a stroll in the opposite direction to La Rambla and exploring the area were you will stumble across the most wonderful bars and restaurants at much better value. Took a room on the fourth floor, room was nice and clean, laminate floors throughout and a wonderfully powerful shower, plasma TV – only downside was that the laminate floors meant that when the cleaners came round in the morning the noise from the corridor was greatly amplified. Breakfast was continental – ok – as I love a full English breakfast – not so keen on the sausage and egg provided as it wasn’t what I was used to so I got by on the tea and toast - but everyone seemed to be enjoying it - if you prefer something heartier then there are plenty of cafes around. Found the staff helpful and the taxi drivers knew where the hotel was so no trouble finding it. Over all I think I would stay here again, location was great and for the price the standard of furnishings and quality was top notch – would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: miliwalsh
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel. The hotel was easy to find (we walked from where the airport bus stops at Plaza Catalunya, 10mins). The area looked a bit dodgy at first but other reviews had also said this. It turned out to be quite a busy area (all night) so never felt worried because there were always lots of people around. The hotel is on a small side street so no noise problems. The hotel itself is a great find. Shop around different search engines for the price because there are large diffeneces. The price we got was excellent value for money for a really nice hotel and great location. The staff were very friendly, room was lovely, spacious and quiet. Breakfast was included and was good with plenty of variety. Free internet access on two computers in lobby also very handy. We had also booked barcelona football tickets through spanish-fiestas.com and these were delivered to our room while we were out on Friday night (a nice token to come back to after the evening). I would definitely recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there on our next trip to Barca.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal close to La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: scrapple000
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights in a fourth floor room facing out toward La Rambla. It's unassuming on the outside, but the interior is nicely renovated with a clean, modern look. Our room had hardwood floors, a 20" LCD mounted on the wall, a small wardrobe with sliding doors, 2 double beds pushed together to form a single bed, a tile bathroom with grantite sink, and a small balcony overlooking the street. It's not the Ritz-Carlton, but it is a great deal if you're looking to stay close to La Rambla. One of the best parts of the hotel is internet access. Wireless internet is included (just ask for a password at the front desk) so you can access from your room. If you aren't planning to bring a computer, there are also two computers set up for guests to use in the side lobby. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant (who needs to when La Rambla is so close?), but it looked clean. Precise location is about a block from the back side of La Boqueria (a huge open-air market selling lots of fresh fruit, meats, and cheeses). There are a couple of small markets, a laundromat, and an organic vegetarian restaurant on the same street as the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: lassh
Reviews.Content: A couple og glass doors welcomed oss to Principal Hotel. The staff were very helpful. We got a room on the first floor and it was nice and tidy. With an excellent big bathroom. The high ceiling made the room spacious though it wasn't large. Unfortunately the aircondition wasn't working as good as we hoped, but we fell asleep. The street is small and narrow, and when we were there construction work woked us up. It wasn't a big problem, we were going out anyway, and I guess the street we'll turn out nicely when it's done. A breakfast bouffet is available, and we ate there the first day, but found out that it was cheaper for students to get som food at La Bouqeria (which you must visit!)

Reviews.Title: “A good place”
Reviews.Author: Catyn
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean, and we had a nice view of the backyard. The location is good, near from La Rambla and good comunicate. It is a little noisy but only during the day. A good place if you wanna spend some days in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and comfortable, great location.”
Reviews.Author: YourFool
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in easy walking distance of the Ramblas and the Gothic area. Due to road construction, the hotel is difficult to access by vehicle. The staff was exceptionally kind and helpful, providing wine glasses, ice, cork screw, voltage adapter, etc. A first time visitor might be put off by the back road location, but one quickly learns that most of the area's delights are on the back streets. Very much enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Riflerangeblues
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay in Barcelona at the Hotel Principal. We thought the hotel was a great find. It's a good location, just off the Ramblas. It might be the seedier side of the Ramblas, (and it's not helped by the repaving work on the street outside - but that's temporary), but we felt that it was safe and easy to access and represented great value for money. We stayed on the 5th floor and it was a little bit of a rabbit warren to work our way up there, but the room was of a good quality, light and very clean with a comfortable bed and all the facilities we'd expect. The bathroom was great - we were really impressed by the shower and the spacious feel. Breakfast was included in the good rate we got through Hotelconnect. It was reasonably good quality with a choice of hot and cold buffet. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Probably worth noting that there isn't a bar or restaurant in the hotel, but it's hardly a problem as it is surrounded by a host of options for eating and drinking. I'd recommend this hotel as a reasonably priced, good quality option for anyone who's in Barcelona for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “All round good experience”
Reviews.Author: kiwiruss
Reviews.Content: Just back from a lads weekend in Barcelona and the Principal served us well. As other reviewers have said the location is ideal as only a short stroll and you are in the ramblas with all the associated tourist amenities. Rooms were clean (and well cleaned during stay) and had the necessary to make it suitable as a base but perhaps not if you were going to spend much time in them. Breakfast was ok to poor but as you are so close to other offerings then I would suggest a short walk is the best bet. The area behind does become somewhat more sinister late at night (well certainly in the early morning hours) with plenty of prostitutes and drugs on offer, a firm no is usually enough but you may need to be prepared for continual approaches. The reception staff were generally helpful and allowed us to have some of the rooms early (we had arrived at 11.30) and offered advice on transport etc. I would use again should the opportunity arise.

Reviews.Title: “Location is its best asset”
Reviews.Author: Sharon,Dublin
Reviews.Content: 3 Couples from Dublin, all aged 40 ish just back from Barcelona, The hotels location was its biggest asset, 3 min walk to Las Rambles. We booked 3 superior rooms with balcony. The balconys were tiny, you would struggle to have 2 people sitting out, however with new path laying beneth our balcony the noise was too much to sit out. Only 1 of our 3 rooms had the advertised jet shower, in fact our shower needed to be fixed upon arrival. We all thought the breakfast was poor, the hot food was barely warm & the cold buffet was the same as any other continental breakfast we didnt think it was worth €8 each. If I were to return to Barcelona I would stay in the Gotic quarter, just the other side of Las Rambles.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: HarrietUk
Reviews.Content: I was worried after I booked the hotel when I learnt it was on the 'wrong side' of the Ramblas, but it wasn't a problem. There were plenty of people of all ages milling around the area at all times of the day and night and we never felt unsafe. The hotel itself was bright and welcoming. The room was perfectly adequate with comfortable beds, a decent shower and Uk Sky news on the TV. The buffet breakfast was plentiful. Tea, coffee, orange juice. A selection of cold cheese and meats, breads, cereal and hot items such as bacon and eggs. I would recommend this hotel as a fantastic budget option.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, near the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkDave
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel 1 night in January for about 85 Euros. Barcelona was pretty dull this time of year -- this was my third trip to the city. The property was clean, nice bathrooms, we had a balcony in the front with a view of the street. Unfortunately there was construction on our street (new sewer line?) but there was no work/noise during our stay. The front desk clerks were a bit curt. We changed properties after the first night b/c I happened to find a small, very charming, family run 2-star hotel that I had stayed at 6 years before, the Hotel Girona (which is not reviewed by Trip Advisor, but I've seen in Lonely Planet or Rough Guide).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Gareth_Hill
Reviews.Content: Great location for hotel, approx 150 yards from the nearest metro. Clean rooms, air con, tv, radio, decent shower. Breakfast provided lots of choice. Helpful service when obtaining lost baggage from airport. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value!!!”
Reviews.Author: Claire.oconnell
Reviews.Content: Very pleasently surprised. This hotel was very central, a couple of minutes from La Ramblas. Our twin room was modernly furnished and spotlessly clean, as was our en-suite bathroom. Our excellent rate included a nice and varied buffet breakfast, from juice to fruit and yogurt, cereals meats and cheeses/salads, breads croissants and hot food. Staff were pleasent and efficient at all times. The roof-top terrace was an added bonus. An excellent experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: nostaw_01
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at the hotel for 4 days from 09/01/07 to 13/01/07. I was extremely impressed with almost everything about the hotel, especially at the price we were paying. We managed to book the room around two months before for around £50(75 euros) per night. The room was slightly smaller than I expected from the photos I had seen but it was by no means small. It was very clean upon our arrival and was cleaned every day we were there whilst we were out. Having read the reviews on trip asvisor I was worried about the noise and the staff, but the staff were very kind and would help with anything if you asked but I would say that if you make an effort to at least try and speak spanish then they tend to remember you and say hola when they see you, however they speak fluent english so it really isn't a problem. The noise was not a problem at all even though we had a room at the front with a balcony, I would say it was quite nice to wake up to the noise of the locals. The only bad thing about the hotel was the roadworks going on in front of it. It is based on a quiet street but the roadworks make it look ugly until you get inside. As for the city itself, it is beautiful. The pick-pocketting problem didn't affect us thankfully, but I would say as long as you're careful then it isn't a problem, so just take out what you need and leave the rest in the safe in your hotel room. The food tends to be rather expensive in most places on la ramblas and I found a few places where the drink prices were ridiculous but there are a few gems, however don't be fooled into going to the italian which offers a set menu for 6.50 euros, it was quite frankly the worst dining experience of my life. There best places we found to eat and drink where between the hotel and la carme st. Make sure you visit the cathedral nearby, and go to la sagrada familia which is just a quick metro journey away. I would say however that once you've been to barcelona and visited the sights it's not somewhere that I'd desparately want to go back to, but that's only because I've got a lot of other places I want to visit first! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: mollybear
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 3 night stay here and wanted to let people know that its a great place to stay. We stayed in a standard room which had a balcony and a bath (ask for these if you'd like them) and it was very clean and comfortable. It cost us roughly £50 each night including breakfast and its very close to Las Ramblas. We arrived late on a Sunday night and I would mention that if you are walking to the hotel at that time when things are closed, be a little careful as we spoke to some guests that had just been mugged on the way back to the hotel. Don't let it put you off though, just be sensible and keep wallets and things properly tucked away and avoid the back streets (it was a guy who just bumped into the man, apologised and took his wallet without him realising!!) A super place though and we'd definitely go back. Don't let the bad reviews put you off as we nearly did!

Reviews.Title: “Looking for comfort, great location AND value? This is THE one!”
Reviews.Author: Winter_Log_Fires
Reviews.Content: We booked this based on the strength of the ther trip advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. When I go to cities, I have a difficult task to find somewhere in a great location which is clean, comfortable, en suite, tv AND isn't over the odds money wise. This is the best example I've found. AIRPORT When arriving for the first time, when you get outside, go RIGHT! We turned left and wandered for a while wondering where the hell the train was. It's right and up the escalators. Buy a T10 ticket. You can legitimately share them and gives you 10 journeys for a discounted rate. Don't be fooled by other tourists not buying them - they just don't know about them. You don't need to speak Spanish to buy them - the automated machines display in English and even if that fails, "T-10" is easy to spot. You can use these T10's all week on the metro. MUGGING Warned by a million (or so) people before I went. We didn't get mugged - although the Scottish woman in the cheese shop (see below) did say "If they don't get you when you arrive, they'll get you when you leave". I think most people should be fine if you just do some simple things. Keep your wallet in your pocket -when it's crowded or you're on the metro, keep your hand on it. Be aware of who's around you - if you have a backpack, wear it on your front. If you're in a restaurant, keep your bag on your lap or twist the handle round your foot. As long as you don't drop your "sensible" rather than "obsessive" guard - you should be fine. If you're lucky enough to be travelling with someone, keep an eye on each other's stuff. We put the large camera we had in an ordinary looking shoulder bag for safety. And always keep a spare card etc back at the hotel. HOTEL Comfortable beds, bath, shower, LCD television, good maid service, kettle and cups (we provided t-bags and milk). There is a safe, but didn't use it. Just kept things in our bags with a token padlock. That was me being obessive rather than feeling there was a danger of anything being taken. LITTLE SHOP To purchase small things like milk, water, choclate, sweets etc please go to a little shop - you turn left out of the hotel and then right and it's just on the right a little way down. It's a long thin shop. The lady in there is SO welcoming. She didn't have enough change one day for some stuff we bought and she waved us and with the goods and said to pop in another time. We did the next day and she looked so pleased. Glad to show her tourists are good people. BREAKFAST We only had breakfast once and it was average. MUCH better is to go to Bar Ra. Take a left out of the hotel; cross the road and go past the chairs (small square) on left and up towards what looks like a car park. Keep walking straight on. On t'other side of the car park is a great place for English Breakfast and it's good value too. Highly recommend. Yum. Doesn't open until 10 mind you. DINNER NEAR BY In terms of food - Blue Rita is a great place to have a beer and steak. Out of the hotel turn left, turn right and then turn right into the big square on the right - Blue Rita is tucked into the corner. LA RAMBLA BEER Warning - DO not have a drink on La Rambla - we did and it cost 18 euros!! CHEESE You must go to the Cheese shop run by a Scottish woman. 5 euros gets you two small glasses of her wine and three pieces of cheese to taste. DELICIOUS! Can walk from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A budget gem”
Reviews.Author: L.A.Silk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night break and our second visit to this fantastic and funky city. We wanted good value accommodation near the Ramblas and this is exactly what we got. It looks as if the hotel rooms and corridors have undergone recent refurbishment. Our room (104) was smallish but very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a good size and, again, very clean. We had a balcony overlooking an interior courtyard - no view as such, but it was very quiet at night even with the windows open. This is probably the quietest hotel/room we have stayed at on any city break. Breakfast was straightforward with all the usual choices including bacon, eggs, sausages etc. Other reviews talk about the location being a possible cause for concern and, on our arrival, we felt a little uncomfortable trying to find the hotel. However we felt safe walking back to our hotel every night, usually around midnight. I would agree with another reviewer elsewhere who suggests that the location might not best suit a woman travelling unaccompanied. That said the Principal is a budget gem that I would recommend to my friends and family. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: Tracey1977
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 17-20 Nov. Was in a party of 7. The rooms are small and there is some noise but did n't find it annoying. Our room overlooked the street and we had a balcony. I know some of our party had smaller rooms with poor views and light. The rooms and whole hotel were very clean. We ate breakfast each morning. It does not change but if you are n't interested in the full fry each morning it will keep you going until lunch. The hotel also offers free internet access. There are two supermarkets very close to the hotel. On first impressions you make think the hotel is in a dodgy area, there is quite a bit of graffiti on the walls, but we never had any trouble either day or night and the hotel is so close to La Rambla. I would have no problems staying here again but would definitely recommend that you ask for a room with a balcony when booking

Reviews.Title: “No Good if you want to sleep.....”
Reviews.Author: bpascua
Reviews.Content: Hello, I just returned from 3 nights in Barcelona with my girlfriend (we are early thirties) We stayed thursday/friday and saturday night. My thoughts are below - Location - slopey back street littered with drunks. Crappy location but its so close to the ramblas (3 mins walk) that its ok. The hotel is after all cheap (80 e and 60 e) Rooms - Rooms look great, all nicely done out but we had a window at the end of the room that gave almost no natural light. And it was an internal view so we got a soil pipe for a view. But again its a cheap hotel. The worse thing about this hotel is the noise. I mean NOISE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! the walls are crappy stud walls so you can hear people in the rooms 10 meters away farting. People come and go all hours and the noise is unbearable. We were getting in at 3am and waking up at 9am and we were getting disturbed at all hours. In bed trying to sleep I swore never to stay here again. Pay extra and find another hotel. Its also worth noting I asked for a quiet room because I had checked the reviews. So shocking all in all. I stayed at the Jazz before which was 150e per night but my god I'm too old to be staying in these places which are bacsially youth hostels. My advice - Just find somewhere else, the selection is endless.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely surprise”
Reviews.Author: 47Maggie52
Reviews.Content: At first glance the Hotel looks to be situated down a bit of a 'dodgy' side street, however, that wasn't a problem at all, so don't let it put you off. Slap bang right in the centre of town, in walking distance to almost eveything you want to see and do. Subway very nearby if you wish to go further afield. The hotel was clean and the staff were really friendly. We didn't bother with breakfast in the Hotel so I can't comment on that but it did smell nice. The alarm call booked for 5.30 am on the last day was bang on time. Quite frankly, for what it cost and it's location we were really very nicely surprised. Would absolutely go back to Barcelona and to the Hotel Principal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidWebley
Reviews.Content: Very Good hotel for the money. My first room was very clean and well furnished but the window overlooked a vent shaft. After 2 days I got it changed to one overlooking the street which was great and even had a small balconey. Only had 1 breakfast there but it had a good selection and was OK for the price. There are 2 FREE internet terminals. The location is great as it's not far from the Ramblas and there is a goo cafe just up the road. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: vmark1
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Principal. Our bedroom was small but perfectly formed, containing two generous size beds. It was modern, with a nice bathroom and LCD tv. Most importantly it was spotlessly clean. The breakfast was not the best but perfectly adequate. There was a choice of cereal, bread, meat, cheese, fruit and a hot option. The only downsides to the hotel were that it could be slightly noisy - due to the marbled corridors, and the location - although convienient, just 3 minutes walk to La Ramblas, could be slightly intimidating at night . However, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and the price, just 72.75 euros per night including breakfast, was great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and smart, but noisy, small and slightly grumpy”
Reviews.Author: BoddingtonB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Principal for a fantastic long weekend in Barcelona. The hotel wasn't really one of the highlights though. Although the room was very clean, pretty smart and well air-conditioned, it was so small that they couldn't fit a normal sized double bed in there! I asked if any of the other rooms had a proper double bed and was shown a room that reeked of stale smoke, wasn't as well fitted as the first room, and which had a bed barely 4 inches wider. The reception staff weren't sympathic. More of a problem was the lack of sound insulation between rooms. You could clearly hear people talking at a normal volume in all of the surrounding rooms, could hear people coming in on the floor below, and we knew exactly when the room above was taking a shower! Still, it was in a great location and all in all was reasonable value for money. I think we'll be trying somewhere else on our next visit though.

Reviews.Title: “Find a Different Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBM1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Principal in October 2006. I would not recommend this hotel for a number of reasons. First, the location is in a seedy area off of Ramblas. There are SO MANY hotels off of Ramblas that are in safer, less seedy locations. Second, the facilities are average, at best. We were given a room, and were unhappy with the cleanliness of the room. After complaining about the cleanliness, they showed us two other rooms. The last room that we were shown was newly remodeled -- and clean. But, after seeing the other rooms, it seems that new and clean is NOT the standard at Hotel Principal. Third, as stated above, the neighborhood the hotel is located in is not ideal (read Lonely Planet for further description), and for that reason, we asked the front desk for the key to the safe located in our room to lock up our belongings. When we checked out, they demanded that we pay 2 Euros for each day that we used the safe in our room. They do not provide a safe at the front desk. Barcelona is full of boutique-style hotels. Find a different hotel, in a safer location, with cleaner, less grungy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nelly101
Reviews.Content: Hotel Principal is in a small quiet street running parallel to Las Ramblas, only takes 3 minutes to walk to the main street. 10 mins walk to the harbour, 10 mins walk to Catalonia Square, 10 min walk to the old cathedral. Metro close by. Hotel is clean, friendly staff who speak good English, reasonable breakfast, but no other food/restaurant. This isn't a problem as there are so many eateries on Las Ramblas, or down by the harbour, also there's a veggie/vegan/organic restaurant opposite the hotel. Hotel rooms are basic but clean. Free internet access. If flying in to Barcelona, I would recommend NOT catching the train to the city centre. My mum had her purse pinched on this train, and we since discovered (from the police) that there are many gangs of pick-pockets who work this train. Instread, there's a bus called Aerobus which stops outside each terminal at the airport (it's the bus stops with a small blue sign saying Aerobus). This bus goes to Catalonia Square at the top of Las Ramblas, and costs 3.75 Euros. Much safer, I think, and there's plenty of room for luggage. Barcelona is a fab city, I'd definately return & would certainly stay at the Hotel Principal again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jonesk
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the recomentation of the reviews on this website and also a work colleague who had stayed here as well and we where not dissapointed. Clean simple just what you needed for a sightseeing lazy holiday. The reception people are helpful but don't look to happy but they can be approached Was not disapoited great location to the Rambles 3 miniute walk away and straight to a metro station as well as the rambles then over the La Ramble Street to the Barro Gotic area plenty of bars and shops. Enjoyed Barcelona plenty to do recomend the Turistic bus easy to get around and hop on and off when you liked

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Principal”
Reviews.Author: Niknak70
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Hotel Prinicipal because of it's great location and the good reviews we read on this site. We can assure you we were not disappointed at all. Just a short walk from the Ramblas, yet far enough away that you can leave the hustle and bustle behind at the end of the night. Our room was comfortable and clean, with a small balcony. We also found it very quiet during the night, we slept well (maybe that's a result of one-to-many cocktails!!) But seriously, in return for booking this fab hotel, you'll get great value for money, you'll be right in the heart of this beautiful city. Surrounded by many great restaurants and bars. The location and price couldn't get much better. We'll most certainly stay at Hotel Prinicpal again. Enjoy...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and quiet”
Reviews.Author: sarahmay
Reviews.Content: Hotel was central and convenient for most of the centre of Barcelona. We had a fourth floor room with a/c so it was quiet. The place was clean, staff were fine(I wouldn't call them cheerful) and relatively efficient. We stayed two nights and found no problems. Breakfast was extra at 7.50 euro. For the convenience of it, it was what the doctor ordered. Safe deposit box works out at 2 euro a night. Free access to internet is attractive but the letters are worn off the key boards so you have to fly blind so to speak unless you know you qwerty board.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ische
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 4 nights stay with my mom. It was really perfect. The room was big, cool shower with several different settings, flatscreen, ac, local city guide with all needed info about restaurants, bars and the movies. It was quiet, very clean and as someone already said it can pass a 3 star (even that he/she didn't like the hotel too much - we did ;-)). I guess you cannot really find anything better at this location. 2 mins to the Rambla (where I wouldn't really spend too much time anyways) but all the rest of the old town is in walking distance, too. Also Placa Catalunya is quite near, where all major transportation can be found. There is also the metro stop Liceu right on the Rambla. Will definitely book it again when going back to this great city

Reviews.Title: “Near the action”
Reviews.Author: kennyg345
Reviews.Content: If you're wanting a room with a balcony overlooking the Rambles, then don't book this hotel. If you want a hotel within a one minute walk from the Rambles yet still quiet, a very clean hotel that has been modernised, good rooms but forget about the view, very pleasant staff who are helpful and speak English, and at a good price for the location, then this is the hotel for you. They also do a hot breakfast which is quite the exception. Overall we (two couples) thought it good value for money and would recommend it, and use it again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Very inpressed”
Reviews.Author: Hannahcem
Reviews.Content: My mother and i stayed at the Principal for 4 nights in mid July and i thought it was great. The rooms were basic and on the small side but very clean and functional with 2 huge comfortable twin beds and a tv that had 24hr English language news. The bathroom was mammouth with a crazy shower thing that shot water out at every direction you could want.! As for the shower doors i don't know what all the fuss was about! We had a good breakfast there everyday with plenty of fruit, cereal, pastries, yoghurt, ham, cheese, bread etc to choose from. There was also some hot stuff but in that weather i couldn't face it. The A/C in the rooms was a god send and worked perfectly. It was in a great location just 3 mins from La Ramblas and although not in the nicest area it wasn't scary . The next street over had lots of girls loitering and we got a bit lost round there but i didn't feel threatened. And its very close to a metro station as well which was brilliant. All in all i thought for the money we paid it was a real find and very good value for money. I'd maybe stay further over into the Gothic Quarter next time i visit but that'd probably hike the price up. I'd also recommend the veggie cafe Organic across the road - amazingly tasty!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: blondepuff
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my partner at this hotel in August for 5 nights. The hotel is in a fantastic location and the double-glazing was excellent which was very welcome for a good nights sleep. There was a small balcony leading out to a nice terrace. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was small but very clean - our only problem was with the bed. We had a standard double room as there were no twin rooms available and the bed was very small. There was a slight problem with the shower screens and wet floors as mentioned in previous reviews but nothing major. There is a key card that activates the lights, and also activates the red light on the outside of the door. We had a late morning one day and were not disturbed by house-keeping as they could see that we were still in the room. Great when you need a bit of a lie-in! We had no problems with dogs in the area, all the dogs we saw belonged to someone and were well behaved. We never felt threatened or concerned when walking to the hotel at night, and wouldn't describe the area as seedy. The area is slightly off the bright lights of La Rambla and doesn't attract many tourists and has loads of character. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as there are so many options around the area so can't comment on the standard of food. Considering the location and the quality of the hotel, we felt that 79 euros a night for the room was excellent value and will definitely stay here again when we return, but we will make sure we can get a twin room!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location.”
Reviews.Author: STW
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very reasonable. We stayed for two nights, the rooms are clean and have A/C. The breakfast consists of a simple selection but was fine. It is also very near to La Rambla and pretty near to the beach. Overall, very good value for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “the truth”
Reviews.Author: aynge
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean. It can pass as a 3 star hotel by its appearance. The shower doors are poorly designed. When you take a shower the bathroom floor gets saturated. Which keeps the room nice and humid and when you lay down for bed. You can feel the moisture on your sheets. The breakfast menu never changed. It was better than just pastries, juice, and coffee. The hotel is close to all the party people on La Rambla, but this side is a bit seedier than the other. The rooms do not have Internet access, there are only two computers that the entire hotel must share. There is Wireless in the lobby for your own personal CPU but it is not free. The counter staff is friendly but be sure to count your change if you pay in cash. You may be shortchanged. The rooftop has a nice view and is a relaxing place to sit however it closes entirely too early. I would not stay at this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointed compared with previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: Lainee_L
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Barcelona. I decided to book the Hotel Principal because every single review for this hotel was excellent. I was slightly disappointed to find that it was just an average hotel. I was a lone traveller and had paid for a twin/indvidual use room. If there had been two people, we'd have been sitting on each other! I also paid for breakfast and compared to some other hotels I've stayed in in Europe, there wasn't that much choice of food. Despite the above, there were some plus points to the hotel. It was clean and the free internet access was a bonus. The hotel was ideally located away from the noise of La Rambla; all the main tourist attractions were within easy walking distance. Apart from having a two day pass on the Tourist Bus (two days are definitely better value for money as each tour takes two hours), I walked everywhere else. Before I went to Barcelona, everyone said it was very notorious for pick-pocketing. As a single, female traveller I was orginally worried about this and also, El Raval (the area where the hotel is situated) has a bit of a dodgy reputation. I did have heightened wariness about this and especially as my mum's purse was stolen literally within minutes of us being in Rome earlier this year. However, I didn't see any pick-pocketing in Barcelona and felt very safe. I would definitely recommend people to err on the side of caution though.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: windsurf-girl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and very nice for a 2 star hotel. The bathroom was very nice, one thing to note though, the shower base was VERY slippery so take care! The location for sightseeing was great, although I wasnt very keen on the area. This is the only downside to my stay. Saying that we never felt threatened at all. It could just have been down to me pre-judging the area from other reviews and from guide books saying be careful. It has a great value restaurant literally just across the road called 'organics'. They do 4 courses for 9 euros, and 2 of the courses you can have as much food as you like (salad and soup, and the salad is very good. the bread is also really nice! they bake it every day) We ate there 3 times and the food was really good each time. (lunch time - didnt try the evening food). they also do massages as well! hope you have a great stay... ps barcelona is fantastic i loved it and hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel so convenient to the Liceu metro stop on one of the major metro lines (green)! Very close to La Rambla where the action never stops. All the sights are within walking distance or just a short ride on the Metro. I could not believe this hotel was only listed as a two star. The rooms were immaculate. We had a plasma tv, jet shower, and a balcony. Rooms are small (just enough room for a queen bed and place to walk around the bed, and a closet and desk) but efficient. Good breakfast buffet and knowledgeable staff. I would definitely stay there again. You can not be the location or the price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just had 3 night stay at this hotel where everything is just as all the reviews have already said i.e. fantastic value, great location, very friendly and helpful staff, spotlessly clean and great buffet breakfast. Will definitely be back to this hotel and would highly recomend it anyone going ro Barcelona. We had a twin room on second floor which was spacious and very comfortable. (Irish)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a 3night stay at the Principal. 9 girls on a Hen Party. We could not believe is was on a 2 star one of the rooms had a plasma screen t.v. and jet shower. Rooms were lovely, clean and well furnished. Staff very friendly except for the manager he was a bit frosty, but to the girls delight the guy on the desk was a double for Lewis Garcia. Great location only a couple of minutes walk to the Ramblas, overall it was safe coming home late at night. Had a little incident just keep your bags close to you. Dont be put off by the streets that lead to the Hotel it looks rougher that it realy is. Had a great meal at La Fonda at the Port Olympic with as many free shots as you could handle after the meal. Good bars in this area, not as expensive as the Ramblas. Make sure if you get a taxi they take you back to your Hotel, they try to say they dont know were it is and try to drop you off at the Ramblas. Beware if you only drink for example redbull they charge you more for it than if you have it with a spirit. (A bit Irish)

Reviews.Title: “Bright Spacious - Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pory
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in Hotel Principal for three nights. The hotel had come recommended by a friend,but I still checked your web site prior to booking. It was an excellent choice, great location, spotless spacious room, calm and peacefull. I booked a twin room and was delighted with it,two double beds really comfortable, a powershower that you could wheel into if necessary. Very well decorated not busy or fussy.

Reviews.Title: “More than happy with The Hotel Principal”
Reviews.Author: Pav
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights last week and were amazed that its star rating is so low. We had actually only wanted somewhere clean and basic at a moderate cost, but The Hotel Principal is spotless with recently revamped rooms which are very bright and nicely decorated. The bathroom also had an excellent power shower. Staff all very pleasant and spoke very good English. The free internet access offered was also useful. A real plus factor is the location. Turn left out of the hotel, a right turn at the end of the street, and within just a few minutes you are on The Ramblas. I had read some reviews about the hotel being in a dodgy area, and yes, if you venture into the streets behind the hotel, you find prostitutes hanging about so the simple answer is just dont go that way. We never felt threatened at all during our stay. Took a taxi from the airport to the hotel which cost 26 euro, but decided to get the airport bus for the return journey. This leaves from the placa de catalunya (10 minute walk at top of The Ramblas) and only costs 3.75 euro. We intended to have breakfast at the hotel (just over 7 euros if not included in your deal) but discovered The St Josep market on the short walk to The Ramblas. The fruit selection packs and freshly sqeezed fruit juices on offer were just fantastic and so the hotel breakfasts did not happen. All in all, a great place to stay to which my wife and I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Principal is the business”
Reviews.Author: Hampshirelass
Reviews.Content: Hotel Principal is ideally situated half way down Las Ramblas, in a quiet road a few minutes from this busy thoroughfare. We stayed here 3 nights; Sunday-Wednesday. Great value for money, it is immaculately clean, the staff are friendly and very helpful, speaking good english. There are two sized rooms, standard which is small and superior which is much larger. Ours was superior on the top (4th) floor, had a double and single bed for the two of us and a spacious bathroom with a small bath/shower; air conditioning and flat screen TV. We had breakfast included (so shop around for the booking), the buffet had a good variety on offer, all was fresh and well stocked despite the fact that it was very busy around 8:30ish. Free internet and coffee & cold drinks/snacks dispensers off the lobby. If we return to this fabulous city, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, very convenient and quiet location near Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: PorscheMainz_Germany
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Principal from February 6 - 9, 2006. The hotel only recently received its 3rd star and we found it to be an excellent choice (approx. 80 Euros + tax for a double room). It is located about 2 minutes walking distance from Las Ramblas and 10 minutes from the harbor. We advise taking the public bus from the airport to Plaza Spanya (probably spelled wrong). From there, you walk down Las Ramblas for about 5 minutes, before taking a right to the hotel. We also did some wonderful dining in Barcelona during our 8-day stay and highly recommend the following two restaurants. Both are located about 10 minutes walking distance from the hotel and very good dinners cost "only" about 12 - 15 Euros: La Dolca Herminia (Magdalenes 27 / 08002 Barcelona) and La Fonda (carrer dels Escudellers 10, near placa reial).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our three night stay at the Hotel Principal. It is a quiet hotel situated just minutes from the Ramblas. Our room had everything that we needed, and the staff were more than helpful. I had ordered a bottle of Champagne prior to our arrival for a Birthday suprise. This had been put into the room, on ice, complete with two glasses and a message from the hotel. Breakfast was excellent - hot and cold buffet along with juices and various hot drinks. All in all a great hotel that I would thoroughly recommend. And Barcelona is a fab place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Principal Very Good - except for the noise!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Principal for three nights from the 20th Jan. The location is PERFECT...only 2 mins from Las Ramblas, and the metro station 'Liceu'. The hotel was spotless, the room(which was very small but that does not bother me on hols!!) and bathroom were spotless, and the breakfast was spot on, loads of choice, just what you needed to start the day, as Barcelona is a WALKING city!! If I had to crib I would say because the hallways are marbled floors, it was a bit noisy, we didn't get in until after 12 a few mights, and had sampled some lovely Mojito cocktails in the Candela Bar near the hotel, and we were still woken at three from noisey people returning. Having said that, if I was to go back to Barcelona I would definitely stay in this hotel again! Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked Principal hotel after reading the reviews in tripadvisor. The night we arrived we were given room (127) which was one of the non renovated rooms of the hotel and we were greatly disappointed. The room had a barred window with the view of a brick wall and no natural light. The bathroom was also tired (rusty bath and cracked toilet). Eventually next morning we asked to be moved and we were given 117 which was recently renovated but nothing like what we had read on the reviews here. Nice room but again no natural light. The location of the hotel is excellent, rooms are clean, breakfast is average. Good choice if you are on a budget holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: oldwulf74
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Principal. The staff were polite, helpful and approachable. The room was clean, the bathroom more than adequate. The choice for breakfast was wonderful. All in all, an excellent city-centre choice for exploring the city. Anyone that complains about the graffiti outside, or the area, or the lack of minibar etc is visiting barcelona for the wrong reason. When exploring a city like barcelona, all that is needed is a bed for the night, a bathroom and some breakfast. We couldn't fault it at all.

Reviews.Title: “OK For Short Break Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: RockChickJan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short 2 night break. The hotel is tucked away in a side street, half way along Las Ramblas (in fact a side street off a side street). The street on which Principal stands is rather grotty with a lot of building work going on and rubbish in the street. We had a room with a balcony overlooking a rubbish skip directly below. Inside, the hotel is sparse but clean. We were shown to our room on the first floor, having been lead through a 'rabbit warren' of corridors to get there by a member of staff. The room itself was quite small but very clean with a small but again clean bathroom (no bath, just WC, sink and shower). The street was quiet at night, but we were rudely awaken in the mornings by noises from the builders on the street, and I think work being done on the lift which was next to our room. We took advantage of the optional breakfast (7 Euros each) in the hotel. The breakfast was OK, the usual sort of thing, a selection of cereals, cheese, meat, croissants etc. Would consider staying again. Good central location, need to sort out neighboring streets.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: kilmistr
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a good hotel. The room was clean and I had a balcony overlooking the street. The hotel can be quiet, but the halls seem to generate echos, so if there is noise, the sound gets bounced around alot. The hotel is located off of Los Ramblas. I felt safe the entire time I was there. Its not the best neighborhood, but you should not have a problem walking to or from the hotel. There was internet access provided in the lobby of the hotel. The staff seemed o.k. The water was hot in the shower. Hard wood floors in the rooms. You can catch a bus to and from the airport for about 3.50 euros and buy tickets on the bus. The bus stop is right outside the front of the airport. It will take you to the north end of Los Ramblas square, (although it makes a few stops along the way). The walk to the hotel from here is fairly easy. Where the bus lets you off, you can catch to go back to the airport. Metro and bus are very easy in Barcelona. Also there is a laundry mat right next to the hotel. About 5 euros to wash, 1 euro each 10 minutes to dry.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Principal
HotelInfo.Address: Junta de Comerc 8, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
